reviewDescription: I truly love Anker power banks, I’ve had one since 2019 that still works great, although it’s now taking longer to charge. I purchased this one in January 2023 for an upcoming trip and it worked fantastic. Charged well, was able to recharge my iPhone 2.5 times before having to recharge the bank. It never overheated. It was a little heavy, but the usefulness was primary over the size and weight. I had used it regularly, once or twice a month since to charge my phone. Unfortunately the power bank will no longer recharge.While I'm glad it worked when I needed it, I’m sad that it’s basically dead after 14 months. Hopefully the next one will last longer.

We bought one two years ago and loved it. It took a long time to charge up, but held the charge for a very long time. Very happy with that one. We could charge two iPhones from below 20% quickly and it would have between 50-75% battery left.We just bought two more and the quality has definitely decreased. They don’t hold nearly as much charge as the older models. Now if we charge one iPhone that’s below 20% it takes the same amount of battery as charging two used to.I don’t like paying the same price for something that has dipped in quality. With that being said I still think it’s a decent power bank. Just not as good as it used to be and we will explore other options in the future to try to find the original quality.
Holds charge for along time... Happy with the performance!!

reviewTitle: Keep with me all the time
reviewDescription: This is my second Anker “brick” charger - they are the best.  I can charge 2 phones at once with this and it holds a solid charge for about 5 days.  The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because the charging lights are very small and somewhat hard to see, the older charger had larger bright blue  lights on the side.  Anyway, still happy with the purchase, can’t go wrong with Anker.

reviewTitle: Very useful as a power bank
reviewDescription: This is very useful as a power bank.  I've charged up my phone with it several times, and used it to keep one of my drone controller from discharging so fast while it was being used.The one thing that makes this a 4-start rating is the user manual.  It's very sparse and gives no detail to things such as how long it may take to charge it fully.  All it says is "Recharge using the USB-C or Micro USB port."  In multiple languages.  That's it.  It doesn't even tell what the lights on the button mean while charging -- you have to guess they mean the charge amount.
Muy bien

I just bought this powerbank and it really shows it got some juice inside since its weight is heavier than the other powerbanks I used such as the Incipio Cell Phone power bank.The only problem I have is when charging the powerbank, I have to lift it to see how many dots it has since when you look at it from the side, you can't see it nor glance at it. You have to grab it yourself or get in a right angle to check how many dots it has charged.Will update in about a year or two on how this beast would serve me.UPDATE 3/31/23 (1 month use)I used the powerbank for about a month now and it charges pretty fast, even with the trickle mode, you could charge your phone up to a 100% granted that you don't use it while charging.If you charge it without using the trickle mode, it still charges and boy it does charge for a long time, it took about 5 days before it reached to 3 dots on the button which is great if you're traveling somewhere that does not have any outlet.The cons that I experienced besides the viewing of the dot thingy is the lack of other options of using a usb. You have to use a usb-a, you can't use usb-c since that part is only charging the powerbank itself. Search for another product if you want an almost universal charging port or charging your mac even.Overall, its pretty good for use while traveling to charge your phone while having a lot of juice so you don't have to worry about charging your powerbank for a while.will update in a year this time.UPDATE 3/22/24With the advent of USB-C, I would look for other power banks other than this. It's a good backup power bank but there are better alternatives out there. You can hand carry this power bank with other power banks such as the anker powercore+ on airports. I wouldn't return this power bank if you bought it already since again this can be a good backup power bank when your good ones run out of power since 20k is alot.Otherwise return it or look for a better one.

reviewTitle: Lightweight and packs a lot of juice
reviewDescription: It’s small form-factor and weight makes it easy to fit it and carry around on long walks. The massive 20,000mAh cell capacity provides more than 5 charges for my iPhone 15. I could simultaneously charge 2 phones with the help of 2 USB A ports. I wish it had USB C output ports instead for charging phone. It also comes with lightening cable so one less cable to buy if you’re still using iPhone with lightening ports.For other android based users and devices that need usb c compatible ports, you’ll need A to C cables.I would recommend white over black but go ahead and grab this before it gets sold out. this particular model provides best value for money among all.
I love the product but the reason for the 4 stars is the US-C port doesn't charge. I use the US-C cable to charge my phone and iPad I am very disappointed I wonder why I use the Anker cable.

reviewTitle: Don't buy accept used/refurbished battery chargers.
reviewDescription: I received a "used/refurbished" Anker PowerCore 20k battery as a warranty replacment after product failure, which after testing several times does not perform as required.  This battery charger does not hold the charge for very long and depletes very quickly.  I am not impressed with the performance of this "used" item and very dissatisfied at this point.  I purchased this item for travel originally, but now it has been almost useless on my trips.

I take very good care of my batteries. And this one wanted a whole lot. I loved it when it worked, but about two weeks ago it stopped taking a charge. So it’s completely useless. The reason I’m leaving the review now is because I had to order another battery. Definitely not the same. Try one that’s less than half the price that has better reviews. So we’ll see.

reviewTitle: Great for the 6 months it worked…
reviewDescription: I am so disappointed because this portable charger has a great capacity and is conveniently shaped for travel. I wish the output had a usb-c option but that wasn't a deal breaker for me. Now, 6 months after really liking this charger it has stopped charging my devices.I have Anker cables because they are honestly the best but I’ve tried 5 different cords (some different brands), tried troubleshooting with resets, but nothing is bringing it back to life. I love Anker so this is very heartbreaking.

This was a great portable charger for 2-3yrs.  But the capacity to charge performance started to dip after that.  The unit has swollen and has cracked the case.  Now it’s good for maybe 1 charge on my iPhone.  I expected more longevity and durability from the Anker brand.

I bought this to replace a Ravpower charger I had used for many years but would no longer charge. Initially it didn’t seem to be charging my phone (it would disconnect) but I realized it was that my charging cable was broken so I bought a new one. This also revealed to me that while it does have a USB C port, it can only be used to charge the battery but can’t be used to charge your phone from the battery, which seems extremely stupid to me, since I would prefer to use USB C to charge since it charges faster that way. I didn’t have another USB cable so I had to buy a new one. Another thing is that this battery cost $60 which I thought was pretty pricey. The Ravpower one I had previously was not as powerful since it was 16750 mAh and this is 20,000 but I spent $32 on it back in 2017 so spending $60 on a 20,000 mAh battery in 2021 seems very overpriced. In fact I only bought this one becasue I tried to order from Ravpower and they took 2 weeks to just cancel my order. So I figured whatever, Anker is supposed to be a good brand so hopefully it will be worth the extra money (almost double the price.) But the biggest issue is that when using this battery to charge my phone, it becomes very difficult to use my phone. I was trying to take photos and videos in Instagram at an event and I had this plugged in to make sure my phone didn’t die, and I literally couldn’t use my phone. It causes the phone to glitch and freeze and there will be long (10-20 seconds or even more) delays between clicking on something and the phone responding. My phone doesn’t do this when not using this charger. I’ve noticed it comes and goes, and sometimes my phone is fine while plugged in, and other times it slows down and glitches but it’s happened enough times that I am sure it is this charger/battery that is causing this. For such an expensive item I’m pretty upset at it’s performance. I wish I had stuck with Ravpower which is cheaper and hasn’t let me down in the past. What I will say is that it does hold a lot of charge and recharges my phone relatively quickly, which is nice but it’s what I expected. I did not expect the downsides.

reviewTitle: Worked for a while then had issues
reviewDescription: It worked great for about a year. Then, like a lot of other reviews on amazon, the battery pack swelled and cracked the outer shell. I stopped using it due to a possible fire hazard.

reviewTitle: Good Brand but mine was defective
reviewDescription: I ordered this powerbank in the beginning of February since i lost my old one (same one as this one)The first thing i noticed when i got the package is that they dont come with the bag anymore. That stunk cause i used that bag to hold my wires in and i dont have it scattered everywhere.Secondly. After a month and a half of light usage, it doesnt hold a charge anymore. I charge it and the battery indicator says its full or close to it but as soon as i unplug it, it wont work/charge my devices. This was a real bummer
I bought this and the usb-c didn’t work, so I returned it and got a replacement and it still doesn’t work 😩

The unit I received did not provide fast-charging on my Galaxy S10, my daughter's Galaxy S10e, or my wife's Galaxy S22.  The listing makes it clear that it is meant to provide this feature.  I contacted Anker support directly and they instructed me to conduct an exchange through them.  Do not do this.  The process took over a month from start to finish and ultimately ended with me receiving a replacement unit that came in a package that appeared to have been previously opened (might have just been the same unit I sent in that was returned directly back to me) that still did not provide fast-charging.  Now the Amazon return window has closed and I have to go through their customer service process to hope for a refund.  Hopefully they can deliver on that at least.Update: Anker's Customer Support replied to my request for a refund and only offered a 10% refund and to have me keep the unit that doesn't do what it advertises.  That's a terrible solution.  I contacted Amazon to explain the scenario and they were able to issue a full refund the way it should have been done by Anker.
This does not have a USB C port for my new iPhone rapid charger.. only slow charge USB.  Had to return
Good until it stopped working out if nowhere less then a year after purchase not worth 40 bucks
It works but it has low storage of battery.

Been a good battery back up, just over 4 yrs old. Case is cracking now so battery is obviously swelling, battery going bad.  It can & does happen especially from cheap ones. Not going to use it anymore due to being a fire hazard now.  Posting info for FYI to buyers of any battery.
My sister had this, she let me borrow it. We charge three phones throughout the whole day. The battery didn’t even go halfway. It’s great.
Tiene buena carga, es transportable, es un poco pesado, el usb C solo es para carga del portátil no sirve para cargar otros equipos como dice la descripción
It was just too heavy for my preference and needs. I returned it and got a 10K unit.

reviewTitle: Overall a good battery - Slow charging time but long life.
reviewDescription: I like this battery overall.Likes.1. size for 20K mAh2. Price3. Reliable4. Typical good quality from AnkerDislikes1. Slow charge time. I use an Anker Intelligent charger and it takes a long time. Again, its 20K mAh battery2. USB C port is for charging the battery only.3. Hard Plastic case sides. totally susceptible to damage if it falls from bag onto floor.4. Ports should have rubber caps that peel away to keep debris out when the battery is rolling around in you "travel" bag or truck box.Overall, its a plus for the money. I trust that the cells will last a very long time as Anker made the battery; but it has very few other features. So, a basic battery that you can use on the job, traveling or off the motorcycle, its a winner. Dont expect to charge it back up quickly.

reviewTitle: Best portable charger, but it is heavy
reviewDescription: The battery life lasts for a long time and can charge an iPhone multiple without depleting the battery life. One downside is that it is heavy, especially when you're using it for travel. It also sometimes turns off while charging, but it wasn't a big issue because it only sometimes did that. Just make sure you check on it a few times when it's being used

I bought this charger for a 3 day trip to Disney World, and to my surprise it has so much capacity I actually never needed to recharge it once. And that was for a fairly thirsty Samsung Galaxy S21 Ultra. My only issue is that it doesn't seem to do fast charging, so I had to keep it connected to my phone longer than expected when recharging. But apart from that, it worked great and I had no issues with it. It's a little heavy but will easily fit in most backpacks and larger purses. Would recommend unless you need something to charge in a hurry.

reviewTitle: Lots of charges, buy your own charging cord
reviewDescription: Purchased this for a 7-day vacation in a foreign land. Worked great, charged an iPad mini and iPhone several times over the week, without needing it's own charge up. Once home, plugged it in with the cord that came with it. Checked it after 8 hours of charging, but no change so left it overnight. Next morning, still showed no increase in it's power bank. Long story shortened: Had to use a higher capacity charging cord from a different device to get it to recharge. The cord that comes with this device isn't meant for its own charging.
I’ve had the charger for about 6 months and the battery started to swell inside of the battery pack.

UPDATE: Anker customer service has contacted me and they have been wonderful in rectifying this issue. Very cordial, professional and helpful.  Top kudos for their customer service team!I recently ordered this Anker battery pack again because I was so satisfied with the first one I had that lasted me a few years. The first one has simply run its course. I did not hesitate to buy another one that is exactly the same.What a disappointment. Perhaps it is defective, but it simply does not work. I hook it up to my phone and it does not charge it. The charging icon does not appear at all. (Yes, the battery pack has been fully charged.)I went to start a return process only to find that Amazon states it is not returnable due to components of the battery pack, which is odd because I have returned other items before and was simply provided with an additional label about the contents of the package.There is a link to contact customer service, but the link goes no where. I attempted to request a refund from the seller, but that leads to a notice that I have no eligible returnable items from said seller.I am good about making sure that I have free returns when purchasing from Amazon and this time I let it slip, but I had no reason to look for that stipulation with this order because I was confident that I would be satisfied with it given my previous purchase.Lesson learned; proceed with caution.

It worked fine for approximately one year. Then it simply stopped charging my small electronics. One year isn’t bad, but my last charger lasted three and was still going strong when I lost it. I would not recommend this product.

Update: the Seller takes consumer concerns seriously. I was contacted after this review and offered satisfactory options. So I am changing from 1 star to 3 stars to reflect that.Original review: Doesn’t work. Waste of money.

reviewTitle: Worked great for 4 years until it died
reviewDescription: Bought this in 2020 and 4 years later, charge capacity was still great but out of nowhere the battery started swelling up and cracked the outer plastic and had to instantly get rid of it
Tested:  3 days for iPhone and Apple Watch.  One bar left on return home.  UL yes.  Wilderness tested… prob not the best choice.

This battery has worked great for me. It holds charge well and is a good size! However, I seldomly use it and store it in a cool, shaded cupboard, and after 3 years the lithium battery has expanded to the point that the case has cracked, which is concerning. Anker only provides warranty for up to 18 months and recommends disposing of it. So quality and longevity of this product leaves something to be desired.

The battery was a good source of extra charge for a few years, but over the last few months, the internal battery expanded and it broke the outer shell. Obviously this is not safe and I haven't used it since then. For the price that I paid, I won't complain, it's just a shame as I was recently going to use it on a trip but remembered that it was broken and had to purchase a different one.

Anker has always been our family's favorite brand. Their products have been reliable and long-lasting. However, I'm extremely disappointed that this large power bank lasted less than 6 months.I gave it a 4 for charging power and would have given it a 5 for quick charging power if only it didn't break down on me.  Loved it while it lasted. Too disappointed with Anker.

reviewTitle: Decent but broke in less than 1yr use
reviewDescription: This charges fast and holds a lot! A bit chonky and heavy, and the one USB-C port it has is for charging the battery itself and not other devices so do what you will with that info. Today mine had sadly stopped working for no reason, I did not drop it or anything and i mostly kept it on my desk or bed. I will replace it with a different product or brand, this did its job as advertised but did not last long enough to justify the price. The previous anker portable charger I owned lasted 4yrs through multiple countries and rough use(including deployment so it had literally survived the battlefield),but this broke in less than1/4of that time. With 90% stationary indoor use. Not totally unacceptable but disappointed. If you’re rich and can replace it often go for it ig.

I was excited and looking forward to getting this Anker portable battery charger. When it came I could’nt even use it as the cable didn’nt fit in any of the cables I already have.I knew that it didn’t come with a wall charger, but I have already an Anker wall charger? but again the accompanying cable did not fit. I called Customer Service & wanted to order a compatible charger, gave suggestions but said I have to order it from Amazon.Alright. I ordered the Anker Nano Power111. got it working with the charger. Now, my disappointment— I saw the same product with the same Model No1281 that comes with the same Nano power 111 wall charger.WHY WAS THIS NOT GIVEN TO ME INSTEAD?I thought I was saving money for waiting for Prime Days ( I have Prime), but when I add the cost of the Nano charger that was ordered separately, there was really no savings at all considering this combo with the wall charger is a lot cheaper than the supposedly prime deal I got without the charger.Alright done is done. I don’t like returning things unless defective. This one so far seemed ok.Now I want to know if I can purchase the short cables (about 6-8 inches that works with charger - Apple I phone connection.My neighbor lend me his portable battery charger during the tecent snowstorm when we had several days of power outage. It was an Anker with included 2 short cables that I could easily connect battery to IPhone. He told me to get it saying “Anker is the best!” & said Amazon sells it for 49.99. These are the cables that I am looking for and want as I do not like long cables when connecting battery to phone. I also chose the small Nano wall charger because of its portability for travel & even for home use.Where can I purchase these short cables like the short cables that came with my neighbor’s Anker battery charger? I am so annoyed I want to return what I have & forget about it.Incidentally , I also bought another Anker portable battery for a relative Model A1268.There is no problem with hers as she can use the portals with the included cable to charge & her phone cable to attach to her phone.

reviewTitle: Previous version had full circle of white lights for more accurate battery life detection
reviewDescription: I almost returned this because after 12 hours of charging it still only showed a faint 4 blue lights, while my nearly identical older model of this charger (which I love) had a full circle of brighter white lights for easy detection of how much charge the bank had left.  I double checked and 4 lights is all you get on this.  It does have a USB and USB C option for charging itself which adds flexibility.  I will see how well it charges relative to the older model which has been terrific and why I bought this one on a lightning deal.
Anker makes very good portable chargers,this one has the trickle charger as well.  Good value

reviewTitle: Product did not work, was sent replacement
reviewDescription: Just received the product, and it doesn't work. The portable won't charge, the lights aren't showing up, and I cannot charge my phone. Disappointing for Anker, as I haven't had issue with Anker products before.Update: Contacted their support and was quickly sent a working replacement.

reviewTitle: It is an Anker nuff sed
reviewDescription: I love Anker and their products. The only drawback to this is that the USB C is input only and not for USB C charging. I wish I would have read the description more throughly but it will still work for us.
What can I say. Seems to charge all my junk pretty well. Only 4 stars because I paid for a new one and got an obviously used one instead.

reviewTitle: Doesn't offer the best charge times.
reviewDescription: I hate that this says that it takes 2 hrs plus to charge my Samsung Galaxy s10+. While the older 10000mah power bank takes way less time than that.

Cumplió 95% mis expectativas. Sólido, muy buena terminación y carga muy bien. Debe cargar al menos 3 veces un Samsung s21. Todavía no lo puedo comprobar porque lo cargué 1 sola vez y realicé 1 carga. Si cargara un poquito más rápido sería 5 estrellas. Igual es 100% recomendable

reviewTitle: one of the best chargers out there.
reviewDescription: I own several of these chargers. I also have some solar chargers but to be honest they are too slow to charge. This one will charge fully in a few hours and charge my phone 3- 4 times.
Only thing I don't like is it's heavy

reviewTitle: Good reliable charger but battery expanded and cracked the case
reviewDescription: Full disclosure, Purchased the charger back in later 2020.Now two years in, the charger still works fine.  It charges well but there is one noticeable flaw.  The case has developed a crack right in the center along the full length of the case.It looks like the battery expanded inside, this is a notable safety issue.  If this is indicative of the life span, then the span is just under 2 years.
Great battery, but iPhone cord that came with it was useless. Thankfully a different one worked. Overall worth the price
Battery charger works great! The only thing is the battery status light. It’s so tiny that you barely see it! Hard to tell if it’s fully charged or not.

Overall, I was quite happy with this device for charging while traveling and didn't have access to power next to the bed where I was staying. Next time I travel with it, I would make sure my charging cable was specific to my device (Samsung Galaxy) and I think performance would improve.

reviewTitle: Holds a lot of charge capacity
reviewDescription: Like the item, takes awhile to charge. That’s why only 4 stars but probably will have a long life because it charges slow?
Ordered this last year and it was so good that I decided to order a second one this year.  This year,  it did not come with the mesh/cloth carrying case.  Otherwise,  appears to be same model.

reviewTitle: Great for small devices, not for laptops
reviewDescription: I use this to power my GoPro Hero 10.  Has enough juice to record for many hours.  2 USB-A ports to power multiple devices, haven't tried that.Not for laptops, however.  Won't charge Dell Latitude 5420 laptop, which uses a 65w USB-C charger.  You'll get an "insufficient power" warning and it won't charge.Still a winner in my book.
This battery does charge your phone more than once. The only thing is that it is heavy, and slightly bulky.
Charger works fine, instructions are not thorough both in the package and website.  I do have questions I cannot find answers for, the questions are simple.

reviewTitle: It can charge your phone like 5-6 times before needing to be recharged.
reviewDescription: My only complaint with this thing is that you can only use the usb to charge. i suggest looking into this companies newer portable chargers.
Great charger, but does not show charger charged status. Still a good product.

reviewTitle: Nothing fancy here but it works well
reviewDescription: Charges up OK and see,s to charge my iPad a couple of tomes before it needs a recharge. Good quality case and looks OK. Anker is a good brand and I expect it to last awhile.

reviewTitle: It doesn’t have the mAh capacity printed on it
reviewDescription: While it’s a great battery, it doesn’t have the mAh capacity printed on it, so I can’t use it for my international travels.

reviewTitle: Kind of heavy, wish it had usb-c output, but lasts forever
reviewDescription: Like others have written, this power bank is a bit heavy, so may not be your best option if you're planning to take it backpacking or are concerned about weight. You can charge the power bank itself with a usb-c input but weirdly, there's no way to charge your phone if you use a cable that has a usb-c adapter for output. You have to use a regular usb charger for it.Upside is that when it's fully charged, it lasts forever. You can charge two phones at the same time with it, too.

reviewTitle: Best portable charger i’ve found to date
reviewDescription: This is the best power bank I have ever bought. It’s the only portable charger I’ve been able to find that charges my iPhone XR and my MacBook Pro 13. Other chargers I’ve had in the past have a very low charging rate, but this one charges quite fast and without any issue. The one thing that happened was that the usb connection got loose and can’t charge with usb cable anymore, but the usb-c cable works fine. It’s also not huge and fits in my backpack well without creating too much weight. Additionally the battery life isn’t too bad. If the charger is at 100% and my phones at 5%, I can get it to 100% in an hour or two. If you want a charger that is quick and charges your phone and computer, give this product a try and I’m sure you won’t regret it

reviewTitle: Works fine, takes forever to charge
reviewDescription: So far happy with charger. Works fine with my phone and iPad. Holds a good charge. It is sturdy and travels well.  However, it takes forever, I mean hours, even a day to fully charge it. I’m also nervous letting it charge overnight. I’ve tried different charging cords and so far no difference. Hopefully I’ll find a compatible cord.
Doesn't support fast charging on galaxies . Ok though

I took this power charge bank all the way from US to Italy to use it when I needed extra power to find out too late that it doesn’t charge my iPhone. I couldn’t figure it out after some frustration. I don’t think I can return the item as I don’t have the original packaging any longer. Didn’t think that it would be a problem but lesson learned. Now I’m stuck with a brick and worth about as much as a paper weight.Update: upon returning my purchase, Anker made contact and was helpful in replacing my order. They were quick to respond and took care of my issue. Thank you Anker for your great customer service!

reviewTitle: The PowerBank of this bran are the best
reviewDescription: nothing bad to say about this brand of batteries except that I needed a type c input to charge the devices

reviewTitle: Great overall, just not a fan of having to press button to turn on charging
reviewDescription: Previous banks Ive used never required button press to turn on device. If you like to keep it inside a bag while traveling, youll have to open your bag to start charging every time you connect your phone.Other than that its a great power bank
This charger worked well and the price was great! No problems at all! The only reason that is was not 5 stars is that it’s a bit “clunky and heavy”. I like to travel light in my purse.

Haven't used it enough to rate charging, battery life, or use during travel. Main issue when it arrived was that the directions for charging and use were not very clear. The user manual can definitely use an upgrade. You would assume such a device would be simple and clear; but it really is important to illustrate clearly how to connect the device to charge it; and how to use it to charge other devices.After I've used it a few times, I'll be back with a review addition; but for the moment, I think the above is important to know.

Unfortunately, this takes over 24 hrs to charge up fully and then it takes forever to charge my phone! I was hoping to use this for my outdoor adventures but it will only charge my S22 twice, I needed it to charge my camera also! I've had much cheaper banks perform much better! Disappointing for sure!

reviewTitle: It did not charge my phone an iPhone 14 pro
reviewDescription: It doesn’t charge my phone and I want to return it.

reviewTitle: Does not work for iPhone 13 charging wire
reviewDescription: What I don’t like about this charger is that it says it’s for iPhone 13 pro max but the wires that come with the phone is not compatible with the portable. It fits in the slot but it doesn’t charge my phone unless I have the regular iPhone charging wire. I spent all this money on a portable so that I can use it with the usb-c wire and for it not to work. The battery life is amazing but I want my $70 charger to charge with the wire that comes with the iPhone 13
I bought this one because my previous one was so good. This one not so much it takes much longer to fully charge my phone

reviewTitle: Does not fast charge devices.  Good otherwise.
reviewDescription: Overall, a good battery pack.However, I bought this specifically for going to amusement parks because my battery runs out and now with covid, they want contactless everything thru the park apps, so I need my phone to be powered up and working.Unfortunately for me, it's not a speedy charger.  I was at 20% and my phone said it would be at 100% in about 2 hours.  Wall charger was about 1/2 that.  It's fairly clunky to charge because there's the battery pack and the cord and the phone -not easy to work with in the park.  It's okay, if it can be left in a locker while riding a ride/waiting in line.It did take a bit of time to charge.  So plan for that.  And it will power things and charge them while using, but again it's slower than I was hoping for, for my use.

reviewTitle: Attractive Design, Quality You can see and feel, Fast Charger,Perfect
reviewDescription: I Like everything, looks nice, feels nice, not bulky like other 20000 powerbanks, i just love it, now i guess i need more, since everybody in my home loves this lil guy, everybody wants to use it, just perfect lil device, i always recommend what i really like and trust, and what i dont i always take the time to write a review, so take it from me, you cant go wrong with Anker in any of their Products, i had been using anker for years and until today i keep on getting their stuff  and keeps getting better and better, they always come out with something new, just try it and you wont be dissapointed and of you trust other brands after trying this  you will change your mind, and if you have any issues you will love their customer service, is just great, Anker You Are Just The Best.....!!!!

reviewTitle: It's great but Anker needs to have one for USB C output
reviewDescription: It charges for a while and that's alright, I usually leave to charge when I'm out or during the night, but I hate that it doesn't have a USB C output. Like come on. But other than that, it's solid. I take it everywhere I go and isn't that heavy. Comes with a little bag to carry it in.

I am not sure how good this product may be.  I have never purchased a portable charger before.  Obviously some of the functions are maybe intuitive for seasoned users, but for me it is frustrating.  The instructions are useless.  There are four lights that may a may not light up, what do they indicate?  Can I use both charging ports at once, one appears to not work?  They need to provide done simple instructions as to how to most effectively use this device rather than just showing pictures of the device.

reviewTitle: Usb-c only for input.  Not fast charge.
reviewDescription: Expected newer tech
Lasted 8 months and stopped working. When it did work, it worked great.

She got it on the 23 of April and it stopped working 4 days ago and only used it 3 times in that.My mother in law just had surgery 2 wks ago and has been moved to Cali for a few months for physical therapy. When the nursing home aides packed her stuff for her trip to Calif. they didn't pack the portable charger because it didn't work.We contacted Amazon and they told us to contact Anker so I did I received and message where they wanted me to send them a bunch of information which I did that including the temp address when my mother-in-law is staying until the middle of Aug. So I just got a message back where they want to send more information and then at the bottom of the email they tell me that I could have my mother in law send them a picture of the charger and that they have to get the defective item back before they can give her a replacement charger. They completely disregarded everything I had written them in the first place. They didn’t even pay attention to the fact that I had told them my mother in law was out of state and didn’t have it with her. It’s sad that they do this kind of thing to people and refuse to help them when their product fails. This expensive product suffers from an incomprehensible design flaw: unlike all USB power banks I’ve been using in the past ten years, this power bank turns the outputs off when itself plugged to a charger. This is incredibly stupid as it means the product is useless as a pass-through power device that sits in between an intermittent power source and a consuming device that must be kept running. A case in point is a camera that can be connected to one of the output ports while the input port is connected to a car’s cigarette lighter powered USB power source. When the car’s power is on, the power bank should charge itself while still powering the outputs. When the vehicle is off, the camera keeps working, as it is now powered from the power bank only. When the car power turns back on, the power bank tops itself up, and the camera that is connected keeps being powered, undisturbed. This is how all the power banks I’ve owned so far work, but this Anker product turns the outputs off as soon as its input power is turned on, as a result the camera is no longer being powered and completely depletes it’s own battery. You have to unplug the power bank from it’s charger in order to turn the outputs back on. This is an example of an extremely short-sighted design decision that makes the product completely useless for some scenarios that are/were perfectly covered by existing, older and often less expensive products that don’t try to be too clever and allows charging and consumption at the same time. Using-while-charging is an extremely common scenario: every phone can do that, every tablet, every camera, and every USB power banks I know except this one can do that. I wonder what the Anker engineers were thinking when they though it was OK to turn the power off when the bank gets charged. The output power should never be interrupted for as long as there is power in the internal battery. If the charging current is less than the consumer current then the bank’s will of course get depleted, but at a slower rate. I’d give minus TEN stars for this shortcoming. I’m now left with an expensive $50 brick.

reviewTitle: Don't buy this - it doesn't hold charge and takes forever to charge
reviewDescription: I bought this for a trip overseas. I charged it before I left and had the device off. When I arrived it was already at 25% battery. I again charged it at the hotel - it took about 6 hours to build up to about 75% battery at which time I left on a trek. I took it with me and used it to only partially charge my phone a total of 2 times, at which time the battery was dead. For how little charge it gave it is not worth the weight or price
Turns off by itself while charging, takes forever to charge phone. Shipper sent wrong model , product.
very bulky, heavy, only lasts for few hours even when fully charged. I want to return

So I bought it last feb 2023 and I didnt use it until this month of may 2023. Its not charging, I have 23 percent and instead of the batt percentage going up its going down 22 then 21. I wasnt even using my phone I turned off everything even put my phone to airplane mode but didnt help. I prolly got e deffective one cause I had 2 anker before without prob and its charging fast! Im just dissapointed with this one and I wasted my money now cant return it cause its past the return window.
Stopped working almost exactly one year after purchase. Very disappointed.

This was my 4th  product by this company and it was my worst experience. The super slow charging was a pain but then the ports got loose. The USB-C port failed to work from day 1 and after the charging port became damaged and stuck I tossed it away. This didn’t last 3 months.

reviewTitle: End cap is incredibly thin and cheap plastic.
reviewDescription: I was sitting in my computer chair, ready to plug this into my phone, when it slipped out of my hand onto the floor, a 20" fall. Well 90% of this device is covered in very tough plastic. However, the end cap, which in my case is where the charger landed on, is pathetically cheap, and busted apart.I now have a mostly unusable charger from what I had assumed was one of the Premier electronics accessories companies.

I used to have RAVPower power bank and lasted 2 and a half years which isn't bad.  When it broke down, I bought this expecting Anker power bank will be as good or even better due to its popularity.  I was wrong.  I tried charging my Samsung Galaxy S21 5G with different cables.  It takes 4 hours to charge with original Samsung cable.  It takes 2 and a half hours with Aukey cable.  Even with Anker cable, it takes 3 hours.  I tried all these cables with an original Samsung wall plug and they charge at least 2 times better.  I am tech savvy.  I had Fast Charging on in battery settings.  I even tried turning on Super fast charging with no luck.  I trusted Anker products all my life but this power bank let me down.

reviewTitle: Loses charge within 2 weeks when not used
reviewDescription: I charged my mobile just once with the battery bank on full charge. Then left it unused for about 10 days. The noticed that it has lost almost all of it's power, and needs to be charged again to be usable. This has happened multiple times now. Sometimes the lights showing charge level are always on as well, even when no devices are connected, with just the cord inserted!Haven't seen these happen with older Anker power bank models. This model seems defective.

I initially let the battery charge overnight. Tried to charge my phone which was at 50% just to see how fast it would charge. After 10 minutes the battery pack turned itself off. I tried to press the button and it just flashed at me would not turn back on. I unplugged my phone and plugged it back in and the lights came back on and charged for about 5 minutes and then died again.  I replayed this scenario about three times before deciding to return it.  I expected more from the name Anker.

When I plug my Samsung note20 ultra in, it says "Charging 1h 55m until full" for about 15 seconds, then the estimated time jumps to 3 hours and 58 mins! Im not using the phone or anything while charging, and the note is 6 months old. Is this an acceptable charge time? I've found it very impractical over the first few months of use as I've traveled.I'm disappointed Anker, please let me know if I have a defective bank or if I spent $59 on the wrong power bank for the features that matter to me. :/
This is not compatible with apple usb-c cords. It will not charge my Apple Watch.

reviewTitle: It is huge, but has major flaws.
reviewDescription: It is the largest that can be carried on a plane, so that is good, but it only outputs on USBA, so it is slow, and too large to carry on a daily basis.  It can charge mini USB or c, but cannot discharge c-to-c. We kept it for the size, but for the price I expected more out of Anker.
this powerbank has all 3 outlets as USB only, no USB-Cs, so you wont be able to charge airpods or watch if you have got USBC cables for them.

This does not fast charge.Also, other review photos and videos shows this battery coming with a little bag.  There is no bag anymore with this device.Very disappointed.  For $50 I really expected more from Anker.

reviewTitle: Incredibly long charging time, for okay battery life.
reviewDescription: Simply put, this was disappointing. It takes almost a full day to charge to max, but lasts far less than that, just to use it to charge my phone. I'll use it for now, but I regret choosing this particular product.
Just got my powerbank thinking it fast charges and its just a regular charge. False advertising when they mentioned its a fast charger.

reviewTitle: It lasted just 6 months. Its dead now. Does not charge or turn on.
reviewDescription: It lasted just 6 months. Its dead now. Does not charge or turn on.

reviewTitle: But why do they keep breaking?
reviewDescription: This is my second Anker charger. These things aren’t cheap, so I’m not sure why I have to keep replacing them. I bought my current one in June suddenly it won’t take a full charge anymore. It only charges to 3 out of 4 bars. Honestly, if you’re going to throw money down the drain for a charger you may as well find a cheaper one, because this one breaks just the same.
It is not compatible with my apple phone. I was disappointed.

reviewTitle: Not what I expected. Awkwardly big. Short life.
reviewDescription: I have purchased two other versions of Anker battery packs and love them!!! And they are half the price of this one. I assumed this was the best of the best. I am not impressed. It is very big and awkward. It overheated my phone the first couple times I tried using it. IT DOESNT LAST MULTIPLE CHARGES!!!!! For the size.... I expect more life in this thing! I am not happy with this purchase and wish I would’ve bought one like I’ve had in the past. Way better and way cheaper.
Heavy. Slow to charge. Both ways.

I have several anker battery products and i like the quality of the cell, how ever i noticed this 20000mAh battery pack is not a fast charger. I have an anker 10000mAh battery pack purchased 6 year back, which is a fast charger though.  Who want to buy a regular speed charger these days! Disappointed with this battery pack.

I had a maker charger before and I loved it and I need a new one for traveling but I’m being nice by giving it a 2 stars I have been charging this portable ever since it got to my house which was yesterday afternoon and I checked again this morning and it was barley charge 😭😭😭😭 . I have being using anke for years and I will still buy from them but I’m sad .

reviewTitle: Make sure you got everything in the box
reviewDescription: Mine did not include a charging cable and mesh bag that its supposed to have. My friend order the same thing from same url, received his today as well, and he got both. Disappointed in not getting what I paid for!

Love the size, perfect for travelling.  However, 1 year after very light use (I probably used it 10 times max for travels) the battery is no longer working.  For the price range, I expect better durability.

Worked for about six months and then the charging capacity broke. Now it takes about six hours to charge my phone, no matter the cable I use. Very frustrating as this was not cheap and I've treated it well
Too heavy to walk around with
Bummer that it stopped working after a few months…

It keeps turning off at the two dots when trying to charge something. Not sure what's up with that but it is only week one first charge.  Always have had great luck with Anker not sure what is up.  Looking into returning

This was great while it lasted.  I could charge my phone around 4 times before I needed to charge up the bank again.  Last month however it stopped charging my phone.  It'll still charge itself, but can't pass that charge along to my devices.  Kinda blows that it didn't last a full year even.
Charges slowly.  Heavy.

Just received 2 days ago. I like the solid feeling in hand. It seems to be of quality build. But 1)you need to reconnect the USB side of the cable each time to charge your phone; 2) No LED display of existing power; 3) Can not charge phone while being charged. 4) Charging and being charged is slow which is no big deal to me since I’ll charge it before I go to sleep.

I've only had this for about a year and now it's cracked and expanded and I have to throw it away. I'm glad it didn't explode though. While I had the battery pack it was pretty good it charged my phone multiple times but I'm sad it didn't last more than a year.
This doesn't fast charge like my last one did. DISAPPOINTING!

Battery lasts really long. really really long. 5/5.Slightly heavier than I expected. 4/5.Can't charge my ipad well enough. 1/5. If I'm using the ipad and charging in parallel, the battery keeps going down, and eventually gets turned off. I have to stop using the ipad and charge. Don't like it - my previous battery with 10000mA current could charge it to 100% while I was using the ipad.
This is unfortunate. I thought it was a good product. It stopped charging after few weeks.

reviewTitle: Issue with using type C charging cable
reviewDescription: I bought this portable charging battery for extra power supply while on traveling. It good enough for couples of charges.  There is issues with type c charging it’s only used for the usb to C but for my battery it doesn’t work from typec to iPhone charging

reviewTitle: Boat anchor heavy no wall outlet cord included
reviewDescription: This thing is very heavy and perhaps useful for charging laptops but to carry this thing around with you in your pocket for your iPhone noway, don't go there. No wall outlet cord included therefore if you are in a hotel with out a USB jack you are out of luck in charging this colossus.  No instructions included what so ever.  Once you open it you have to figure it out by searching google.  It maybe a useful battery but its negatives outweigh its strengths for me
I've had Anker products in the past and they have been amazing, this one however isn't as good as previous models, it hardly charges my pixel 6 and one of the outlet ports is broken out of the box.

I have had  a more expensive anker charger for over 6 years and it can charge my s22 ultra like 4 times no problem but this one only seems to charge it maybe twice before needing a charge and it takes forever to fully charge. Like I plug it in at bedtime and it is still not charged when I wake up and my other anker is and lasts longer. But since this one on under $40 and my other one costs like $60, I guess you get what you pay for.Update: seller contacted me and was very helpful to correct the problem.

reviewTitle: USB-C Port Provides No Output and Quite Heavy
reviewDescription: It is a large and heavy battery. USB-C provides no output, only input. Most Apple cables now come with USB-C adapter on one end and and Apple adapter on the other. This battery will not work to charge Apple products with this type of cable. It is difficult to see charge level unless almost looking directly at the button. Overall, a solid battery, but without some important features that prevent me from recommending it or buying it again.

When using outdoors (which seems like one the major use cases) I can’t read the LEDs to see how much power is available or whether it is even charging. It’s a pain.  It has a lot of power and seems to get the job done. The price was right.

reviewTitle: Great little backup battery on the go
reviewDescription: I love Anker products, so I don’t really have anything bad to say about them. This is a great battery backup that’s easy to pack in a bag. Only draw back I see is it doesn’t have a USB-C output. I should’ve read the specifications more closely. Works great as a battery for an in-luggage charger.

Wish I would've shelled out the extra 20 bucks for one with fast charging. Works well for charging gadgets; we primarily got it to keep in the diaper bag when we forget to charge the stroller fan which it does well. But when either of us plug our phones into it they charge super slow; like if you're thinking you'll plug your phone in for ten minutes at the bar and you'll be good for another hour, don't buy this charger.

reviewTitle: I have mixed feelings about this power bank
reviewDescription: This power bank has a lot of capacity and can charge multiple devices before it needs charging. However, I have noticed that whenever I use it charge my phone, my phone battery runs out much faster than if I had charged it with my regular wall charger.
The charge lasted a long time on this but the weight of it was heavy for my intended use. Wanted to use for a backpacking trip where weight matters.

reviewTitle: Lasts quite a long time but takes for ever to recharge. Wonky USB connections
reviewDescription: So initially I really was looking for a heavy duty battery for a full day of walking around where I might not have access to an outlet, on that front it did very well charging even two phones. My gripe with this however is two fold, both of the output ports are USB-A and the input ports are Micro USB and USB-C; either this battery is really old or someone has their priorities mixed up. I need at least ONE USB-C output as well, and had to suffer around looking for old school USB-A cables to really use this thing. Lastly it takes darn forever to charge even with high-amp/rapid charging blocks. Not the quality I expect from Anker, really. Poor design decisions make this a less than ideal choice.

I was looking for a replacement for my Aukey 30000mAh portable charger and thought this one would be sufficient. Unfortunately, even though it advertised as such, it does not fast charge my phone. Charging is slow to normal at best, which is not what I was looking for.EDIT 6/28I did revise my review score. Customer support reached out to me immediately upon my initial review and insisted on rectifying the issue. They honestly went above and beyond to try and diagnose, and when the issue could not be resolved they offered to either replace the item with one that would work or provide me with a full refund. Completely hassle-free and have left me a satisfied customer. I'm leaving this particular product at 3 stars sldue to the fact that it didn't work as advertised for my phone, HOWEVER, I would definitely purchase another product from this company.

reviewTitle: NOT SUITABLE FOR IPHONE OR APPLE DEVICES.
reviewDescription: This portable charger would be perfect for any other phone. Excellent charging power & battery life. Great for traveling. Can charge multiple devices at once. BUT IT RUINED MY IPHONE BATTERY.  I used it maybe 7-8 times during my 2 weeks trip to Europe. And after that I noticed my iPhone 13 Pro requires more frequent charging. Battery life depletes faster than before. I got the phone last year when it was launched. It’s in perfect condition. Instead of getting the Apple certified Mophie Powerstation from Apple store, I got this one after watching lots of videos/reviews. And none of those reviews mentions that it compromises the batteries. If you have Apple devices then get the portable charger from Apple Store. Those are Apple certified and compatible with Apple devices. If you have Samsung or any other brand it would be an excellent choice!

I found this charger by trying to look for the more expensive option since it’s a charger and didn’t want to cheap out. I am happy I went that route!! I’ve been amazed with the quality of it, it’s heavy and not cheap which is good because that means it will be resistant to drops and stuff. It is about as big as my phone. It is simple to use and works amazing. The battery life on it is great and I like how it doesn’t use battery if you have nothing on the other end of it so I can leave my usb in and as long as it’s not plugged into anything it won’t waste battery I think that is good for keeping my usb with it. My only concern at first is that my usb wouldn’t fit in all the way but I realized it was just right because it was new and I pushed it in harder and it fit. Which is a good thing because that means your usb will not fall out and it will stay in there and not keep falling out and being annoying. It uses usb 3 and it says “IQ” technology on it and it must be way better than a normal charger because this thing charges fast and has amazing battery life at the same time. I also like that it has 2 inputs (how you charge the battery itself) it has usb micro and usb C inputs which is cool. My only complaint is that it doesn’t have usb outputs espcially since the newer iPhones come with that type of charger. I’m so happy I picked the Anker charger and didn’t cheap out!!! Great product!!!

I've bought 2 of these power banks now: 1 as a gift and the other for myself. This is the perfect power bank for traveling since it is able to charge my phone multiple times before it needs to be charged back up. It's a bit on the heavy side, but I'm also able to walk around with it in my back pocket as needed if I'm charging my phone on the move. It does not have quick charge, so my phone won't get back to 100% as fast as my wall charger, but it's nice to not have to be tethered to a wall as well.I have tried using this power bank to charge up my Macbook Pro and didn't have great success charging and using it at the same time. It might do just fine if the computer is sleeping, and will need to test that at some point.As someone who doesn't do a ton of traveling, I still use this power bank quite often even around the house. Moving my phone from room to room with the power bank is much more convenient than having to remain close to a wall outlet. It's really an impressive battery for its size and I would definitely recommend this for anyone looking to keep multiple devices charged or who does a lot of traveling.
Anker products are great. Very well made and always function well.

reviewTitle: Work Good.  Good amount of power storage.
reviewDescription: Fast charges my son's iphone 13.  doesn't fast charge his watch though that may be the magnetic base that limits charging speed.

The Anker PowerCore 10000 is a compact and lightweight portable charger that offers excellent performance and value for money. It features a 10000mAh battery, which can provide up to two full charges for most smartphones or one full charge for most tablets. It also supports Power Delivery, which means that it can charge your devices at up to 18W, which is significantly faster than traditional portable chargers.  While specs promise 2 full charges it seems like I will often get 5 or 6.In my testing, the charger was able to fully charge my iPhone 13 Pro in just over an hour. It also charged my iPad Air 4 in about two hours. I was also impressed with the charger's efficiency. It was able to charge my devices for a longer period of time than other portable chargers of the same capacity.I primarily use the charger to keep my smartphone charged as I am streaming my daughter's softball games.  It can stream a 2-day tournament with out even worrying about the cell phone running out of juice.In addition to its excellent performance, the Anker PowerCore is very well-built. It has a durable plastic casing and a cross-hatch texture that makes it easy to grip. The charger also comes with a USB-C cable and a travel pouch, so you can easily take it with you on the go. Strangely enough the pouch is extremely handy and one of the best features of the charger.Overall, the Anker PowerCore 10000 PD Redux is an excellent portable charger that offers excellent performance, value for money, and build quality. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a reliable and portable way to charge their devices.Pros:Compact and lightweightSupports Power Delivery for up to 18W chargingFast charging performanceEfficient battery lifeDurable constructionTravel pouchCons:None that I can think ofOverall rating: 5/5 starsRecommendation: I highly recommend the Anker PowerCore 10000 PD Redux to anyone looking for an excellent portable charger. It offers great performance, value for money, and build quality.

I bought two of these for camping. They work great for charging ours phones and headlamps. We have Galaxy S22's and get 4 full charges easily off each one. The smart charging works great, shuts off the battery pack when the phone or other device is fully charged.

This charger is awesome and lasts forever! Although it can feel a little heavy it is exactly what you want to have on hand when traveling or going to festivals! You’ll never be worried about having a dead battery with this charger!

reviewTitle: This thing has saved my life
reviewDescription: This is the best travel companion I’ve ever had. I used to be constantly stressed about preserving phone battery and whatnot while waiting for trains or flying or just walking around - no more. It’s got such a nice form factor, slips in anywhere, and it feels like I never need to top it up until I’m back home. Writing this review from a train station while charging from it.I would get the one with a USB C output next time, but I would never consider a different model.

reviewTitle: I use this power bank a lot!
reviewDescription: I love this power bank, although my only complaint would be its bulkyness and the fact that all my type C chargers have type c charger endings but that isnt this chargers fault. Ive had this charger for now about 2 years? And I have dropped it a lot and only about a month ago did i break an outside peice. So its very durable! Its battery capacity is amazing and can last for a long while! (abour like average 4 days for me or longer) Its display for the battery life is good as well! It tells you how much battery the charger has left!

reviewTitle: Still holding a ton of charge, useful during travel and power outages
reviewDescription: Bought this a while back and it still is trucking right along. Holds about 4-5 charges worth of my iPhone SE. Very useful during travel and power outages to keep your stuff topped off.

reviewTitle: Worst charger I have ever had from Anker.  Got it in December getting rid of it 3 1/2 months laater
reviewDescription: Got it in December getting rid of it 3 1/2 months later.  Wont charge half the time.  Waste of money

reviewTitle: Charger Stopped working in some inputs after 2 months
reviewDescription: Charger worked fine in all inputs the first month after I bought it. The second month it stopped charging my iPhone in some of the inputs. I went to the store and they tried new cords. It still didn’t work. I was traveling and desperately needed certain inputs to work. This charger’s quality is POOR, UNSATISFACTORY for some of the inputs.  Buyer beware.

Bought this in July 2021. I don’t use it that much, maybe once or twice a month. Now when I try to charge it , it won’t charge past the second blue light. When I try to use it, it dies after charging my phone for about an hour. Tried charging it through both inputs, same result. A little disappointed, it’s a really good product and I wish it lasted me more uses.

I purchased the Anker power core 10000 in 2018, which works great and completely charges a smartphone in about 20 minutes. So I expected that the same brand, twice as powerful, twice as heavy, twice as big, would be just as, if not better.Nada.As in, my smartphone has been plugged in for 8 hours, and has gone from 20% to 30%.Total waste of money.

I bought this for my grandma who loves Facebook more than I do, but needs her phone to have enough battery to take endless photos. I purchased one in June 2022 and it recently stopped taking a full charge and would only get up to one light charged. I figured she had worn it out, so I purchased another one on February 5th, it has already stopped taking a full charge and she can only get up to two lights charged no matter how long she keeps it on the charger.  I have an Anker power bank that I purchased over 3 years ago and it’s still working just fine, unsure if it’s just this specific product or if the quality has gone down.

reviewTitle: Takes way too long to charge
reviewDescription: I don't know what accounts for the disparity in time, seeing a lot of reviews saying theirs charged in six to ten hours, but mine took a full 24 to charge for the first time. Which just isn't reasonable or efficient for "on the go" use. Using it to power one single device, however, quickly revealed that the wait was not worth it as it drained half of the battery in a few hours. Can't even imagine trying to power 2 at the same time.I don't recommend it at all. For 40 bucks less you can get a bank that will charge much, much faster and be more useful and practical to take on the road. For 40 bucks more, you can get a full-blown portable power station with a lot more features/uses that will hold a lot more power.I can't think of too many situations where this brick will actually be useful. Don't recommend.

So my old anker power bank I bought in 2013 charges while it was being charged.I could plug my devices into the Anker to charge while the Anker was plugged in to a charger in the wall, go to sleep and wake up to everything with a full charge.I’ve only had this one night and both my phone and ipad still need to be charged this morning.I paid twice as much as my old Anker and lost functionality!I’m absolutely frustrated! Now I got to go, and use the power bank first thing this morning.What am I going to do at 2 o’clock when I need it again?I called customer service, only for him to confirm that they took that functionality away. That function is no longer available in any of their power banks.

From the beginning, I thought I was doing something wrong. But now I don't think so. Connected up to my Apple watch or iPhone it just stops charging. The hardware being charged isn't charging completely. You have to push the button on the bank to get it to start charging again. Not a Happy Customer.

I have a Samsung s22 ultra. I charged this portable charger completely so that I can have enough battery to take videos and photo. Did not work at all. It stated USB connected but no indication of a charge. Very dissatisfied.

reviewTitle: Not what I expected from anker
reviewDescription: Normally when it comes to electronics, anker is hands down one of the top, but this product came completely defective. I tried to give it time to see if maybe changing cables was the problem but the charging is too slow, and it constantly stops charging and I need to unplug and plug the cable. When I do get to use it for at least an hour, its battery gets my phone maybe to 60% (from 0) and then the battery pack is dead. Defective from manufactury

reviewTitle: SOOOOO FRUSTATEX!!!! Outstanding product and customer service!!!
reviewDescription: I bought the first one of two of these in December 2020. By January the device itself would not charge. I wrote a review and anker customer service emailed me and offered to replace! Customer service was top notch! However, this second charger the same thing just happened again. The device itself won’t charge. It is wonderful when it works but I will not buy another anker charger. I am not hard on this charger at all. If I’m using it, it’s either in my lap ( I’m in a wheelchair) or sitting on a table. I haven’t dropped it or anything. It looks brand new. SOOOOOOO FRISTRATED!!!!

This charging unit will work great for my travels, unfortunate the usb-c port does not charge any of my devices. Talked with customer service and they suggested an anker usb-c cord that was supposed to be compatible but it still won't charge and I need it for our recent travel. The USB ports work but for the money felt like they should all work.

reviewTitle: Takes awhile for a full charge
reviewDescription: Initial review:  Arrived within Prime delivery window.  As noted by other reviewers, the Power Bank takes a LONG time to fully charge.  Out of the box, the indicator lights showed 25 percent charge.  To get a full charge using a USB-A cable powered by a wall charger, it was approximately 24 hours until the light indicator showed a full charge.  If you're going to need that much backup power available, make sure you start the recharge process early!Haven't tested it's ability to recharge or run devices yet.  Will post a follow on review after using the device.

reviewTitle: hard to tell if it is charging
reviewDescription: My biggest complaint with this charger is that you cannot see if it is actually charging without looking at the very tiny lights inconveniently located on the bottom of the front face. I've had this brand before but not this model and my other one had a very large readout on the that displayed the remaining charger life as well as telling you it was operating. This one is very, very difficult to see if it is actually on and charging.That's a huge negative for any devices that are 'touchy' and don't always take a charge.

reviewTitle: Amazing charge, but possibly faulty to soon.
reviewDescription: Had to return. Usb c to usb c stopped working. Tried troubleshooting for about two weeks before return window nearly closed.This battery pack is definitely amazing. Bisbee the main feature I wanted in a battery charger for my phone didn't work after just two weeks.Regular charging ports worked fine still. Could get super charging speed and adaptive fast charging on Android products. Wife used on iPhone and could get a quick charge as well. Worth looking at if you need a roughly 4 phone charge battery park.
Charging a Galaxy S21+ from 37% to 100% took close to 4 hrs. Tried several other times and decided to send back for a refund.

reviewTitle: Item returned: Underpowered for my needs
reviewDescription: Bought it to power my HTC Vive Pro wireless kit, charged it (takes ages), connected it, it didn't have enough juice, repacked it, returned it.Note: they never advertised it for this use. It's probably ok if you want an inexpensive battery bank for your iPhone.Bought the Nimble charger instead (more expensive brand), super happy with how quickly it charges up and the fact that it can power my headset longer than the controllers can hold a charge.

I originally had the square model but apparently the charging port was damaged and I had to shell out money for another one. No doubt that I would go with another Anker! Their chargers are worth the money and last quite long. I use it for travel and throw one in my purse for an emergency charge. It's great that all Anker chargers come with a bag, which is really helpful in storing a charger cable with it. I wouldn't go with any other portable charger. You won't regret buying from Anker.

reviewTitle: Doesn’t Charge Phone via Fast Charger
reviewDescription: I thought this charge would be able to charge my iphone via my type c cord but it doesn’t.

reviewTitle: Lasts a long time but heavy
reviewDescription: Only negative so far is the weight - this thing is noticeably heavy in your pocket. Despite that, charge lasts a long time and powers up phones quickly. Good product

I should have read the specs before assuming I could include this with carry-on.  It is heavy for even check in I would imagine.  Maybe the battery life and charging power are perfect for those who have more need than I.

Purchased this to use at an all day amusement park in Florida (which will not be named). We recharged two iPhones twice as we worked through 10 hours of fun, rides and and park apps. Love the looks, speed of charging, ease of use  The little carry pouch expands just enough to slide in the cords. I purchased the white and it still looks brand new, wipes off easily. Only one dislike, a bit heavier than expected.  My cousin liked it so well she tossed hers and ordered one on Amazon, caught it on sale!
I have 5 Anker power banks (different sizes).... This was a gift !!!

I purchased this charger during a power outage that lasted 4 days and it became very annoying to be going out to my car to charge my phone. My neighbor recommended this charger. At first I was upset when I realized the cord sent with the devise did not fit my iPhone 8; I then remembered she had an Android. It doesn't matter though as a USB port is always a USB port,  I realized I could my USB cord from the charger to my phone. Perfect fit. I have been using the Anker charger now for several weeks and I find it very convenient. once charged i can use it for a full week to keep my phone charged. No regrets and I would recommend. Too bad the charger didn't  come with 2 black cord, one for iPhone and one for Android users. That would have earned it 5 stars
Can fully charge my cellphone 2-3 times. Just wish it had a carrying bag like the last one I purchased.
This is a good power bank but it is too heavy for travel. I had to return it and bought a small and lighter one. Not sure about the battery life - i didn't try it.

Item defective, but waited until after return period to show up.  Bottom of unit has split open and appears to have leaked material under crack which is discoloring the plastic. If I had it to do over again I would’ve returned upon reception: the item was packed without any padding to protect it from being bang around during shipping, and it seems like it certainly was, no drops since purchasing it! :(Edit: was contacted within a day by Anker customer service, who handled this brilliantly and immediately shipped me out a new unit along with a prepaid label to return the old one.  So far the new one is working fine; I've used several Anker products and this is the first with which I've had any problems, so I will chalk this up to a defective unit and call it good.  Will update to five stars in the future if it works as good as the rest of their stuff has in my experience.  Thanks to Anker for quickly sorting this out!

reviewTitle: Great powerbank, but no C Type
reviewDescription: No C type charging. A little old compared to today's tech.

Took 16 hours to charge to full capacity.  Fits nicely in the hand and not too heavy.  Charged my cell phone in about an hour and half.  My biggest con...very disappointed I didn't receive the nice bag with my purchase and is the reason I didn't give it five stars,

reviewTitle: Burst into flames! Could have lost our home or worse!
reviewDescription: It was a good charger for about a year. Yesterday, my husband - THANK GOD - heard a crackling noise and went towards noise to inspect and witnessed it go from sparking to actually bursting into flames! He panicked and never having had experience with how to put out a lithium battery fire, tried dousing with water. The house filled with smoke in 5 seconds. Fire finally went out and FD came to follow up. They recommend smothering battery fires in the future. No problem! Will not be buying this or any similar device again. Just not safe.
On the 33rd day it only charged to 75% it would not charge further 😢

Although I’ve owned this for over three years, this shouldn’t happen.  Recently it developed a crack and started bulging out on both sides.  This is a definite hazard!  It could start an electrical fire if you continue to use it.  Please be careful.
I have written twice explaining that it doesn’t charge and still waiting a respond

Ordered this power bank because of solid reviews.  Bottom line… this piece of crap won’t charge my iPhone 15 Pro or my iPad Pro (2nd Gen). Tried different cables. Every time I plug it into either device, message pops up and says “Cannot Use Accessory.  This accessory used too much power”.  For whatever reason, my devices think this Anker PowerBank is an accessory.  Don’t waste your money on this one. Look for a different powerbank that will actually charge your devices.

I have loved Anker products and purchased a wide range of cables, external batteries, and speakers from them. They have seemed like excellent value for the price. Unfortunately, I will no longer be purchasing their batteries. Last night while it was charging, this battery almost exploded and could have started a fire while I slept. I purchased it in Nov 2020. This time I’m actually writing a review and posting pictures, but it has actually happened before. I purchased a similar battery from them in July 2014 and a few years later it did the same thing. I didn’t write a review because I thought it was a one-off thing, but after this second incident I now see it’s an issue with their batteries. While those incidents did happen years after purchase, batteries should just get worse at holding charge as they age, not create dangerous situations by almost exploding.

This is my 2nd Anchor charging pack. The 1st one I had worked great. I used it for about 5 years before it died. I bought this one thinking it would be as good. The thing has never worked. I’ve tried everything including new cords, plugging it in to a different outlet, etc.I think part of the problem is that it came with no instructions and no charging cord. It has 2 USB-A ports and one regular one. I’ve tried using each to charge it and nothing happens. I’ve tried pushing the button when I plug it in, holding the button down, and nothing works. I let it charge for different amounts of time even. Very frustrating since this one was more expensive than my other one. Because of that I’m trying a different brand when ordering a new one.
Will  not turn on Don’t buy

Do not buy this item. The battery life lasts a long time. However it has two inputs Micro and USB-C. Only the USB C can be used to charge the item. It has two USB-A outputs. Only one of these works. So you can only have one item plugged in at a time. It is vastly over priced for only half of it to be usable. I would find a better product by a different brand. Do not waste your money.

reviewTitle: Stopped working suddenly, but was great before that
reviewDescription: I typically wait a while to review a product, and this is why. I purchased this device 7 months ago. Before today I would have given the power bank a glowing 5 star review (the product worked flawlessly, reliably, and would charge many devices for several days before needing to be recharged itself). However, today it suddenly lost the ability to recharge itself. I thought it was the cable so I switched out to a new one. When this did not work, I tried a new usb plug. This did not work. I then tried a new cable and plug on a different wall outlet, which also failed to correct the issue. Perplexed, I tried a different device and it was able to charge. After this I realized it was the anker. I then tried the usb type c input port on the device, thinking the micro USB port that I had been using to recharge the device had failed. The usb type c port would not work either. So, it appears that something internal had failed rather than the input port (otherwise the notion of both ports failing simultaneously seemed too coincidental). This is an unacceptably short life span for a device that has remained stationary on a counter and been properly cared for. Anker needs to work on their products to address this issue, because I am not alone in my experience with their products.

reviewTitle: Well designed, compact, easily fits in pocket
reviewDescription: This is a good charging brick and can charge a phone from near dead approximately five times without being recharged. This is my 4th Anker product and I have not gotten a bad one yet.
I only buy anker because it works and lasts!
Excelente
This is a great powerbank and I've used it many times and it keeps my phone and tablets charged
I won't have to worry about my phone running out of charge.
La he utilizado ya hace un tiempo y realmente es muy buena, no tengo ninguna queja, la recomendaría totalmente.

2 years almost 3 going with this charger and it’s been the best. It’s kinda heavy but for the charge and durability, it’s worth it. I now have a small issue now because the battery started to swell( I taped it up) and I’m not too sure about keeping this one, so I need to buy another one. I have recommended this portable to so many people and will never stop
Probably holds 5-6 charges of an iPhone 13, and charges it very quickly.  I use it around the house just to not have to be tied to a wall outlet, because it is faster than the wall too.

We bought this for our European vacation, and it didn’t disappoint. I’m not sure why but when we were on the plane and traveling out of country our phones did not hold their charge for long as they normally did in the states. This charger recharged our phones, and headphones very quickly and still had a lot of juice left. We’ve heard bad stories about compromised charging stations abroad, so it was especially nice to have our own powerful charging station!

I purchased this power bank back in 2020. I absolutely love this power bank. It charged my iPhone X, and iPhone XR multiple times on one charge. I now have an iPhone 15 and it charges that phone multiple times on one charge as well. 2 years ago I dropped the power bank at the airport. As you can see it cracked the case. It still works just as good as the day I purchased it off Amazon. I highly recommend this power bank if you’re in the market for one.
I think it would be nice if it had usb c too but it works fine.

reviewTitle: Anker Power Banks are the BEST!  Perfect for remote travel
reviewDescription: I used these power banks for extended camping in the Sahara.  They have never let me down.  They hold power for a very long time (probably years - certainly long enough for a month long trip).  They deliver the charge to my phone quickly and hold the amount of charge they are listed for.
