They do take some time to get charged up - so plan ahead to get them set up and charged prior to travel or planed use.  I charge a iPhone 14pro with them.  Reliable and hold the charge they are listed for.  (note - you must carry these battery packs in your carry on only - they can't go in your checked luggage)

Bought this for a trip to Hawaii with the wife, and what more can I say?  IT'S A BEAST.  I charged it in early January, used it for the whole trip (usually, I'd carry it in my pocket and keep my aging S9+ topped up, since its battery is slowly dying), occasionally charging earphones or other devices, and recharged it once in two weeks.  Got home and put it away, since I don't really need to use a battery bank per se.  I dragged it out a week or so ago, and it was still fully charged.  I charged my S9+ a handful of times, charged earphones again, and charged my IPhone 12 for work at least three times.  I lost ONE dot on the charge indicator!  I am, needless to say, please with its performance.  It's TSA-legal (obviously), and although you definitely won't forget it's in your pocket, it's nice to know you've got power when you need it!

I use this mostly to charge my Galaxy S21 Ultra while I'm at work. I usually start to charge my phone around 50% and take it off at 100. So far I've gotten 5 charges out of it in one day with the power bank still having 1-2 bars of juice left (out of 4 lights total). So about 3 or so full charges and still power for another I believe.It does take a long time to fully charge, several hours, but it's worth it.I wish I had waited 1 day to buy it though. I bought it for $50, and the next day it was on sale for $36, so maybe wait for a sale, even though $50 still isn't a bad price for it.
This is working really well! It hold its charge even when it's not being used. It doesn't drain on it's own. It lasts a long time and is a life saver!! Thanks!!

reviewTitle: Love this, never had any problems!
reviewDescription: This is the fourth time getting an Anke Power Bank! They work exactly as advertised. I love the new improved power rating and take it with me whenever I leave the house!

Relatively compact for the amount of power stored.  Does take a long time to charge from low level - says 10hrs and probably correct.  Can charge android phone from 1-20% at least 4-5 times.  For more power consuming devices obviously not as many - from 3 lights (~75% of power) completely drained charging a 10" paperwhite Onyx Boox Tab Ultra at 20%.  The Anker 20kmah replaces an old (7yr) smaller battery pack - slightly heavier but not that much larger.
Very impressive power bank, holds a charge for a very long time.Can be stored for months without losing much power, also charges back up pretty quickly,
This battery is powerful and has held its charge while  recharging my phone several times . I have not had it long but it seems to be a very good product.
Great product and good quality
Great product highly recommend

reviewTitle: UPDATED July 6, 2020: The jury's no longer out
reviewDescription: REVIEW AS OF JULY 6, 2020:If you read my older review, below, you'll see I was not really convinced this was the charger for me, nor was I pleased it had, in my opinion, no "operating instructions,"  and having read other reviews that indicated it took forever to charge up, etc.  After I wrote that review, the seller contacted me via email to offer any support, but I had already formed my judgment (not a good thing) and blew it off and never contacted them (okay, okay, I get it; judgmental and stubborn - working on it). HOWEVER, I decided to plug the USB in to just let it charge until I saw the 4 blue steady dots, assuming the unit was then fully charged. And then I took it to our camp in the Maine woods, off logging roads where extended network roaming is the norm and electricity is had only when the generator runs, usually maybe once a day. This Anker unit kept my phone charged (Galaxy S8), my daughter's iPhone charged (and she's on it a lot more than I am), and it charged up our Bluetooth speaker unit so we could take it out on the lake and listen to tunes while boating. To say the least, I was more than pleasantly surprised; I was amazed. I now keep this Anker unit with me and make sure it's ready to go when we head out ~ which with all the COVID crap going on, is as often as we possibly can head to the woods! I keep its charging cable right in the little case it comes in so that when the generator is going, I am able to recharge it in an appropriate AC plug.LONG STORY SHORT: I highly recommend this unit, and I'm sorry I was quick to judge it so harshly previously.OLDER REVIEW BELOW:Okay, full disclosure. I'm not really much of a techie, I just want to buy something that works for me and then plug and go, as it were. So, once I got this, I tried to read the "instructions," but found just a few pictures and most of what was written was in other languages. The pictures really didn't tell me what I needed to know. Do I plug it in to charge it before I use it? Is it already charged (it does have a couple of blue lights but never seems to get to the third one or higher)? The cord that comes with it is apparently for charging it, which is great, but, again, I have to either purchase a charging cord/connector for my Galaxy S8 or use one I've already got stashed for other places (like my car, my bedroom, etc.). I bought this because we have a camp that's off grid, where we have a generator that we may (or may not) run for a couple of hours a day, and we have a variety of phones between us, iPhone, iPad, Galaxy, etc. I don't really want to wait until I get to camp this summer to find out this isn't going to work for me. I even went to the website and called up the unit (Anker 20000) but still don't feel like I got any better, understandable information. So, I guess we'll see whether it's workable for my situation or not, as soon as I feel sure I'm not gonna blow the thing up because I don't have clear instructions on how to get started.
I always have it with me whether commuting to work or traveling

Charges quickly from the wall, then quickly charges my iPhone. This power bank seems to have plenty of charge left after completely charging my nearly dead iPhone, so I do believe its claim that it can charge your phone at least three times.
It came very fast. Easy to use,lite weight. Will purchase again
this is the best charger
Great quality. Lasted me almost 4 full iPhone charges.
Does what it should. I have never had an issue with any anker product
I used it when I travelled in Japan. It's helpful a lot. Long time to charge.
Charged my phone quickly and it’s light enough to carry around all day

I have always supported Anker. I have use many of their devices over the years and have yet to complain...until now.The (charging life is very long). I you need to charge multiple times then this is good for that. When plugged in, it only keeps the device alive while in use and it's very slow to charge. I have used several different style cords.

reviewTitle: Great charger but stopped working after 1 use
reviewDescription: I’ve used this charger before through a friend and I decided to finally buy it since my friend has had it for such a long time I knew it was going to be a great charger. Unfortunately after 1 use the charging light doesn’t turn on and I’ve tried different cables to charge it but the light just won’t turn on to indicate it works. I don’t know if I got a defective one but I’m just upset because I know these are great chargers but I got stuck with a bad one.

Maybe i got a defective one but this thing sucks. I usually love anker products and I purposefully look for their products whenever i need something like this (phone charger, cables, outlets, etc.) but this one is a huge miss. For the price point, you'd expect it to do better. It cant charge my phone(iphone 13) while I'm using it. It'll barely keep it at the charge but if its plugged in and I'm using the phone, it will not bring up the charge. Ive tried different cables and everything. It just is a miss

The Anker PowerCore Essential 20000 arrived today.  Opened it up and pulled out the "User Manual".  What a piece of trash.  The 2 1/2" x 3 1/2" pamphlet (certainly not a manual) contains instructions in 10 languages, all written in 4 point font.  As close to totally useless as you could find.Then I see there's a web site for support, go to it and what do they have, the same pamphlet the only difference being you can increase the screen size.So I thought I'll go to UTube someone must have a "how to use" video out there.  You will not believe how many videos there are showing the viewer how to "unbox" the Anker.  I hope this thing works better then the crappy instructions.

After only 3 months of using the power bank, it keeps shutting off out of the blue. Not sure why, so I need to keep pressing the button to start the charging process again. Also, it takes 10 hours to recharge it.

I used this at Disneyland. It did the job of charging our devices well. The only con is that it is heavy and bulky for my average size pockets. I hated having to hold it in my pocket with my phone. It was heavy big and inconvenient to have with me while walking all over Disneyland. Besides that annoyance, it did its job of charging our phones all day. So if you don't need to lug it around this should be perfect for your needs of long lasting charging of multiple devices.

I bought it to charge my iPhone while traveling. The battery of this power bank lasts a long time. However, not only it's very heavy, but the ports are not compatible with iPhones. I had to use an extra USB to Type C adaptor to connect the iPhone cable to the charger. What's the point of that? I would have preferred to buy a lighter and smaller charger if I had to use the adaptor anyways or just buy a charger really compatible with iPhones. This is a misleading advertisement.

Doesn't charge s22+ Samsung... at least mine it didnt. ... charges everything else. Charged it.  Rode  1000 miles on my harley. Rolled into a gas station....quick charge..... NOTHING... Just me,  use your best judgment... might just be me.  Things I've seen in youtube... their not ready.... your call.. wasn't there for me when I needed.

reviewTitle: Decent charger but very outdated. Not recommended
reviewDescription: It’s a good charger if you have any older devices that don’t use USB-C. It will charge my Apple Watch but that’s it. You cannot charge anything that has come out within the last few years as most electronics have switched to USB-C. Unless you want to downgrade your fast charging cable to standard usb to lightning cable or to usb c.
I purchased this product because it had USB-C and Micro USB ports however those ports are for charging the device - they are not output ports. Sending back and looking for a more useful product.

It is much heavier than I expected.  I thought it would be the weight of a cell phone but it is close to twice that weight.  It has a couple of USB A ports for charging your electronics.  It has a USB C port and a micro usb port for charging the unit from a power source.  A cord (USB A to Micro USB) is included to charge the unit.  It's really too bad they didn't include a USB A to USB C cord instead.  Then you could charge the charger with that cord and then reverse the cord to charge you phone with the USB C end.  The instructions allude to several charge rates for phones and tablets and a slower one for earphones.  There is a button and some blue lights but how they work is not well explained.  They suggest you visit their support page for more information.  I did that and the only thing you get is the included manual as a PDF.  No additional information. So to summarize it is a heavy unit that will definitely charge stuff if you can figure out how to use it.  It could be made better by substitution of a different included cord.

I purchased this product in August 2020 and have been using it regularly to charge phones and other devices. One great feature is the ability to recharge it using either a micro USB or USB-C cable. However, the power output is quite basic, and it doesn't support any fast charging technology, which is expected given its affordable price of under $20 at the time of purchase.Unfortunately, I noticed that the battery started expanding or bulging recently, so I decided to stop using it. Interestingly, I also own another Anker battery pack that's even older but has been used just as frequently, and it's still functioning perfectly. So, the performance may vary from one device to another.

reviewTitle: Sad it didn’t work like it claims for iPhone 15 Pro Max
reviewDescription: I had to return this but wanted to give my ultimate review. I heard Anker products are amazing and had to try. It said it would work for my iPhone 15 Pro Max but when charging or attempting to? It said it was too powerful for my phone and would not charge, so ultimately had to return and am on the hunt for a portable charger that will charge my phone and my husband and son’s devices (iPhone 13 mini, iPhone XR).

UPDATE 10/28/20:  A couple weeks Anker saw my review and was kind enough to send me a different version of the PowerCore Essential 20000.  The new one is functioning the way I hoped it would - I've charged my phone from 20% to full two times and most of the indicator lights are still lit, reflecting that I should be able to charge my phone at least 2-3 more times before the Anker needs to be recharged.  I'm very happy about that!  Thank you, Anker!ORIGINAL REVIEW: In 2015 I bought an Anker® 2nd Gen Astro E5 16000mAhthat I used ALL THE TIME.  The only reason I replaced it was because I gave mine to my daughter and bought myself a new one.  She uses it and despite being five years old it faithfully is able to charge up her phone 2-3 times before it needs to be charged itself (when I first got it I could charge my phone 6-7 times in between charging the charger, which was outstanding).Back in April 2020 when I purchased this charger, I imagined that buying a higher-powered, brand-new charger would enable me to once again charge my phone at LEAST 5-6 times before needing to be charged itself.  Unfortunately, that is not the case.  I have a Galaxy S9 and if I'm able to get 3 charges out of this new battery, I'd be surprised.But that's not all.  My daughter can fully charge the charger in 4-5 hours, and I'm stuck having to charge mine overnight because it takes twice as long.The new charger is frustrating - it actually performs THE EXACT SAME as the 5-year-old Anker that I gave to my daughter, despite being a better and brand new charger.  Very disappointed.

Some of the ports already don't work and it's only been 6 months. It's been in a case and isn't exposed to the elements. I can only use the 2 USB ports and not the others. Worked great when I first got it but I can't use one charging cord that I have that was the reason I chose this charger to begin with.

The charge cord/plug for the device is an Android plug. Standard USB plug. This means you must carry and fuss with yet another different cord.  That said 92 hours of battery life is great. I will keep it but the no standards for plugs is sooo frustrating!

I bought this 6 months ago and it's already starting to fail. The micro USB port you charge it through is starting to fail and has become very unreliable. It's a shame because otherwise it's very good.Update: Anker gave me a full refund for this item. Thanks

reviewTitle: Great battery, only had USB charging
reviewDescription: I saw the usbc 's on this thinking it could charge from there too but that is for input only. I have way too many devices now that come with usbc cords, not USB

reviewTitle: Beware! This no long includes a carrying case and a USB to USB-C cable.
reviewDescription: I just bought this Anker recharger pack for a fourth time. I bought one in 2022 and two in 2021. This time, however, I found it no longer includes a carrying case and the second cable, which was USB to USB-C. Be wary of what they say in the small print as to what is included. It's annoying not having the additional items I received in the past. Is Anker starting to cut corners with shrinkflation?

Anker makes great chargers and cables. I was hoping to use this one for ALL travel including airplane. Talk on the site indicated it would be ok. However when the package arrived it said in bold letters on the label, that it is not legal to use in aircraft. Too bad, it seemed like a nice charger.

Product worked with the charge that came from the factory, but would never take a charge after that.  Finding info online about the LED colors and meaning is a hassle.  Finding a product manual online to help with understanding the product not easy either.  They are dying to sell you a powerbank, without a manual, without a charger, that's hit or miss as to whether it works or not.Update: I eventually figured out how to work this thing and all is OK.  Would be a good idea for Anker to include a quick start guide to get a customer started.

11/18 Update: They just reached out to me for a refund, I will use that money to purchase from Anker again because I genuinely love efficiency!  Thank you! I’ll try an even newer power bank with higher charge and more costly, this is how you keep me coming back!The multi use Anker 🔌 is amazing btw! 👏 what other company works this fast??11/15 I bought it in June and it worked great, but lately the recharge time is much longer and the usb C port doesn’t work ! This is such a disappointment considering I’ve been recommending this battery to all my family and friends to get especially for traveling ! Now contemplating should I buy Mophie instead …

reviewTitle: Not for Ring.com Stickup Cams. Otherwise fine.
reviewDescription: This does fine with my iPhones, and in fairness, that's all Anker advertises. This would NOT charge my Ring.com stickup cams.  I suspect the voltage is just a tad too low for Ring.What's interesting is that Anker's smaller 10,000 unit (i have 2) WILL charge Ring cams wonderfully.  Apparently those put out just enough extra voltage

reviewTitle: FAR fewer charge cycles than a Smartphone.  Dichotomy!
reviewDescription: These packs last only a year or so.  Compare that to your Smartphone.

reviewTitle: sure its got capacity, but its a slow charger
reviewDescription: its a similar size to my phone, but twice as thick, and a little heavy, but it has a pretty good capacity.but the thing that ruins this is how slow it charges. tried diff cables, including ones that are fast with other sources of power, and everything charges very slowly. my phone estimates that it will take 4 hours for it to get to 100% from 15%.

I bought it two months ago and never hd a chance to use it. Two weeks ago, I tried it and found one of the USB port was not working. I tried two chargers, two cords, and two devices. It failed to work. I contacted Amazon customer service and a lady gave me the company's link and let me filed an online inquirary. She said the company will contact me in two business days. Two days later, no one contacted me and I called Amazon again and asked a replacement. Now, two weeks passed and the company still did not contact me.

I got this product June of 2021 and it was great. Charged amazingly, was fast charging, gave about 3 charges + before needing to be charged. However before even hitting a full year the charger stopped charging and would just blink on the first light. I really liked the charger but it stinks that it didn’t last long term despite I only used it maybe 10 times.

reviewTitle: It charges my phone, just REALLY SLOWLY.
reviewDescription: This charger is too slow.Previously, I had the smaller Anker charger (10000 mA) purchased in 2016. It charged my phone really quickly, like 30-45 mins from almost empty to full. It kept working right up to the day it got lost, a few weeks ago. :(So I got this even bigger one, and I was hoping for the same speed and just more charges.This Anker model (with 20000 mA) so far holds a charge. No fire worries, which a few other reviewers mentioned. But it is SO SLOW to charge my phone, and also to recharge itself. It took 24 hours to fully charge up this battery when I first received it. It took all night to charge my phone with it (from 20 to 100%). Also, it is longer and of course heavier than my previous model.All this to say, I recommend getting the older smaller model.

A few months ago, I had purchased this product and both times they came with a mesh bag. I expected the same exact product this time, since I chose the link to buy it again, but there was no mesh bag.

reviewTitle: The charging cord did not work for my Apple 12 mini
reviewDescription: It’s ok with the right charging cord but it’s heavy.

reviewTitle: A lifesaver.  Great as a Gift.  A must have.
reviewDescription: We have purchased several Anker battery backup devices.  And very happy we did.  They make a great gift.  The charge is very good.  You get a good quick charge.  It does take a while to charge; so I recommend you charge overnight or during the day when you don't need the emergency power.  these power supply devices are critical in today's heavy device environment.  Don't leave home without one.  Just make sure you have the right mini usb charging cord with you at all times.  Very versatile; works with almost any portable device.  I will definitely buy again if I need.

reviewTitle: Powerful Charging in a Compact Package
reviewDescription: I can't believe how many devices I have that are battery powered and how often I pick them up and realize I forgot to charge them before putting them away or aside. Those devices include especially phone, ipad, and multiple vapes(cannabis is legal here!). This battery pack has repeatedly come to my rescue. It is small but quite powerful and will charge my phone multiple times and my ipad once or twice. With usb c, it recharges in a fairly short amount of time. I have found Anker products to consistently be among the most rock solid electronic auxiliary makers of the dozen brands I've tried.

i been using this 20kmah power bank for abou 6 months now and i love how it has been holding up. i got the black color option. i normally use it to change my iPhone 13 mini which has a small battery compared to the main flagship devices today. i don't always keep track of the number of times i charge through a cycle but i rarely run out of juice from the powerbank before i have to recharge, so that is a good thing. if i were to guess how many charges i would get out of the 13 mini, it would be at least 9 full charges. which gets me through at least 2-3 days without recharging the power bank, depending on usage. the recharge time for the powerbank isn't too bad. it takes about 4-5 hours to fully charge from 0%. i normally recharge the bank whenever i go to sleep, so i never worry about the battery life throughout the day. i do charge two devices at the same time but not regularly. when i have to, it still holds up. obviously, it is gonna drain quicker but this is a stable and quality product. this has to be the best overall powerbank i have ever used. i dropped it once on cement, i have a few scratches and it is still going strong.overall, i would recommend this to anyone looking for a portable sized powerbank that isn't heavy for travel. 20kmah is plenty enough for 1-2 devices for daily usage. 5/5

This suited me for what I wanted:  a way to recharge my phone a few times in the event of an extended power outage.  Once this was fully charged, I was able to charge my Samsung S22 four times from a single charge.  It claims to have fast-charging capabilities, and that appears to be true.The 'charged status' indicator is a bit vague:  there are only indicator lights, each equal to about 25% of battery.  That's how you know how much charge is in it, by the number of lights lit up.  Something with numbers in maybe 10% increments might be more useful, but... it's not a deal breaker.  I just know if my phone is down to about 15% and I recharge using this, one indicator light on this will not be lit, so it uses about 25%.The weight feels slightly heavier than my Samsung S22 in its case, and probably twice as heavy as a Samsung Galaxy S7 that is NOT in a case.  Not something I would carry in my purse but definitely would carry well in a backpack.  The size is about the same as my Galaxy S22 in its case.I have charged my phone and a Samsung tablet with this satisfactorily but not simultaneously.  It has two output connections for charging two devices simultaneously and has two different input charge options (micro USB and USB-C).Overall satisfied.  It fit my requirements for a reasonable price.
This works like a typical charger and will work with low draw hearing aids too. Most do not as they will turn off because of the low draw. Very happy with this.
this is a great back up battery. You can get five or six charges out of it.Great for traveling or at work where charging traditionally might belimited.

reviewTitle: A bit slow when charging devices, but very sturdy and reliable.
reviewDescription: It's a bit hard for me to review the product because I stupidly bought it used. Don't do what I did, you'll end up with a significantly lower capacity power bank. Mine only holds about 13,900 mAh when it should hold 18,000 to 20,000. Entirely my fault. But it works very well. I feel like it takes ~6 hours to charge with a 20 watt USB charger (all power banks take a long time to charge).I've run two phones off it simultaneously and it kept them running just fine. It's physically sturdy and it has never gotten even warm when charging it or discharging from it.My only complaint is it doesn't charge devices very quickly. For both my phone (Google Pixel 4a) and tablet (Amazon Fire HD 10) this power bank can only keep up with power usage of the devices when they are on and active (e.g. you're actively using them while charging). Neither device battery gains power in that situation, but they don't lose it either. When your devices are idle, it's pretty decent. Closer to wireless charging speed (this doesn't have wireless charging capability, that's just a comparison).If you want a power bank that charges your device as fast as your wall charger does, look elsewhere. This isn't that expensive of a power bank. If a somewhat slower charge time doesn't bother you then this is a decent power bank for the money.

reviewTitle: It lasts, it's slim and it's the best you'll get for the price
reviewDescription: Lets keep it short and simple for those that are looking for a good battery bank. Anker is the best brand you'll find out there. Any of the products they sell are worth the money. This one's great because it can trickle charge for those using BT Earbuds and can fast charge a phone like as if you plugged it into a wall outlet. It has four notches like most battery banks and just casually using it barely puts a dent into the battery.I've tried cheap-o brand battery banks, and durable ones like Halo but couldn't find one that was slim enough to keep in a back or front pocket to charge on the go. My friends and I play Pokemon GO during big events at local parks and such; and anyone who has played it know how draining it is on a mobile battery. If you're at a long event you'll be stopping to charge up or have one or two battery banks on you at all times. With this? I barely put a dent into what it has for 3-4 hour events. For the longer 12 hour events? I still had one notch left with it running the entire time. I even shared it with a friend during one of our 30 minute breaks too. It's the best I've had and the only one I'll ever continue to use unless I want to go bigger.

reviewTitle: It is a very good unit but does not have an "always on" feature
reviewDescription: I like this unit very much.  Very solid and well-made.  It has a very high capacity.  I can find nothing wrong with it except that it does not have an "always on" feature.  This, if you plug-in a device such as a cellphone, it will charge the phone.  Then, the power bank senses the phone is fully charged and it will turn itself off.In my case, I need the power bank to be on all the time as the phone is simply used as a Bluetooth device in my car and needs to be plugged in 24/7.  Unfortunately, the phone would charge, the power bank would then shut off, and the phone eventually would discharge completely.  Despite being plugged into the power bank, the power bank won't auto-start again to recharge the phone.Thus, while this is a very good unit and I recommend it to others, it will not work for the application I have in mind.  Also, BTW, there is no "press the button 3 times" thing, as often is mentioned online.  I have tried everything, including emailing Anker (who were very helpful, BTW) and they confirmed what my testing revealed.And, yes, I could build a circuit and all that, but instead, I found another unit that advertises that it is always-on.I returned this item to Amazon.

Bought this for my boyfriend. He’s able to take this on the go. To keep his cell phone, tablet & Nintendo Switch charged. When you can’t get to a power outlet while traveling or in case of power outages during storms this thing comes in handy.

I bought this charger back in Feb and it’s been a great changer. I tried the USB-C charging port on my iPhone 15 and I was surprised that I got a message saying that the power source is putting out too much power. I guess I’ll have to find a portable charger that works with the iPhone 15. Still a great charger.

This is the second one I've purchased. The only reason I'm buying it is because I lost my previous battery pack. The build is solid. It has enough texture to be useful but not enough to be annoying.  After a year of usage, it does not rattle and seems to hold its battery capacity. As with Anker's other products I've purchased and used, I would recommend this one.

reviewTitle: Works great but slaw to charge the battery pack
reviewDescription: This really works great. Get many recharges of an iPhone on just one charge of the battery pack. However, it takes several hours to recharge the battery pack, even using USB C charging port. Would get 5 Stars if it charged faster with USB C.

It seems to hold up well to charging a couple devices at one time and doesn't get overly warm. We may have gotten the wrong type but wish it took USB c to USB c for charging devices. Also wish it was a little quicker to recharge as well.

reviewTitle: Amazing Power Bank, especially for Quest 2, just not the one I wanted
reviewDescription: NOTE: I bought this one by mistake, as I meant to get the one that had PD output through USB-C, so I'm returning this one. I still liked it though.This thing has a TON of battery. I'm sure you can guess that by it saying 20,000 but its no exaggeration!When using it to charge my Galaxy S20FE, it only did normal charging, but that's still good either way. (The newer model fast charges it, which is why I wanted that one)Using my Quest 2, the battery doesn't go down at all while playing. I plugged it in at 9% (took a while to find a decent cable to use) and while slow, it never went under that. It gradually got higher. After say 2-3 minutes, it went up a percentage. Sounds a little bad, but trust me! It would extend the playtime by HOURS! So if you're interested in using this thing as a Quest 2 battery, it's perfect! And the weight is perfect to use as a counterweight when attached to the back of the strap (just don't insert it in between your head and the strap. That will just introduce more stress on your head lol)

I earlier wrote a very negative review,  born out of frustration.  The item does work well, now that I know it doesn't come with the correct cord for newer phones. I still think that the instructions could be clearer. They did offer me a full refund,  which I declined as it does what I ordered it for.Anyway apologies for the negative review.

reviewTitle: Exactly what I was looking for
reviewDescription: I ordered this for the dual USB charging ports.  It's much bigger and powerful than my other Anker chargers.  I can use this for two devices.I do wish the USB c port was an output instead of input.  At least I can use my USB charger to charge it though.I also wish the LED charging lights were a little easier to see.  On my other Anker chargers they're blue and easier to see.

Totally understand there is a correlation between the mAh and the physical size, but this crosses my limit on how much weight I want to carry around. It's so damn heavy. Otherwise, I own 2 other Anker power banks and they're good.

I’ll make this short and sweet:Charging power: Good/great for phones. Not really good for my IPad Pro M1 11 inch, though it keeps the iPad battery from draining.Battery life: I’ll put it this way, i bought this and went on a 2 week roadtrip in august of 2021. Didn’t recharge it after the trip. Left it in my bag without touching it until late April 2022, still had more than half battery and charged a friend’s phone at a music festival (very hot day).Overall Cons:Need a big pocket or a small bag to carry it on you.USB-C & micro USB port is for charging the pack itself, not to charge devices.Small charging cable for the pack itself (but you can use any micro-USB to USB/USB to USB-C to charge).Don’t expect a significant charge for a tablet, stick to the wall outlet for that- or buy a more powerful portable battery pack.Conclusion: Great back up pack, not for heavy duty charging though.

reviewTitle: Very good customer service (will not charge with less than 2A wall charger)
reviewDescription: I was about to return the second one of these and left a bad review on Amazon. Anker reached out to me to correct the problem.  I was using a 1A wall charger to charge the unit and it would not work. I obviously did not read the manual, and never will, but the battery charge light will flash like it's charging but it will not actually charge with less than 2A.  Can't say how good the item is yet, but I was very very impressed with the level of customer service. For that alone I'd buy from Anker again.

Loved it while it worked, great amount of ports and even though it wasn't super fast it did the job! I only bought for a trip and had it used/stored in a hardshell case where it stayed in my purse; using it sporadically now and then once I returned home.It sits on my couch, never dropped or transported after that but has a crack now somehow. I live alone and not sure how it happened. I'm writing this review because I first reached out to Anker as I have always liked their brand and have spent a significant amount on their Eufy line of cameras and security products for both home and work as well as a preferred choice for power strips/cords. Unfortunately they have never responded after two direct attempts as well as a 3rd attempt via Amazon. One star reflects the lack of response even though the item did work well for the week I needed it.
Bought 2, after about a month 1 would not charge got a replacement. Now the replacement stopped working and so did the other one! So three all went to crap in roughly 4 months.

This device will not charge using the C. port. Unfortunately for me this device does qualify for a return or replacement, so I’m out of the money I spent . I will never buy nor recommend an Anker product again.
If you use this to charge iPhone 15, the iPhone sees this as a device to charge, not be charged from. Check the web for a charger compatible with iPhone 15.

This item was purchased for a trip where charging would be less accessible.In the past I have been very satisfied with Anker brand, but this product never worked despite charging over night and the LED light functioning. After reading many other reviews I understood that I also received a poor quality product that I was unable to return due to the time limit on amazon returns after my trip.

reviewTitle: MIcro-USB jack is defective on 2 Successive Orders
reviewDescription: I have owned one of these 325 power banks for 6 months and love it. HOWEVER, I ordered two more this week and both had defective MicroUSB jacks on the battery. These 325 power banks will only selectively accept micro-USB cords while my original purchase does not have the problem at all. I have owned many ANKER batteries since introduced,  and have NEVER experienced a battery charging failure. This must be a product defect, beware if you rely on infallible charging.PS Anker customer support was very responsive and immediately offered refund on defective product

I was excited to receive this charger. Unfortunately, after fully charging, it will not charge any of my devices.  I have tried several cords and nothing has worked. I have contacted customer services and no one has responded only that this item cannot be returned. Very frustrating. This is the second Anker product I have bought that does not work. With many  of the reviews being positive I thought I would give it a chance. Never again.

I bought 3 of these power banks since they were on sale. I gave 1 away as a gift. I charged another with the supplied USB cable. Worked great with charging my iPhone and I depleted the power bank. Tried charging the power bank again and left it plugged into the wall for about two weeks. One day, noticed the max charge little lights were not lit anymore. Now, it does not turn on, does not charge anything, and will not react to being charged with it’s included USB cable. It’s a brick and just shy of my return window with Amazon. I hope the one I gave as a gift does not also die after a few uses.

reviewTitle: No charger or charger cable included
reviewDescription: Charged power bank for over 10 hours using my own power block & power cable.  The battery light indicated it was charging but it never showed more than 4 lights lite up around the indicator lights.  Did not charge after over 12 hours of total charging!??? Verify that my charger and cord works properly but ANKER did not work or charge properly.  this is my 3rd Anker power bank.  The only one that actually worked correctly is the second one I had.  Concerned about quality control with these units??!!
I love anker products but this charger is horrible. Doesn’t hold a charge and does not work with iPhone 15.

I got the power pack for a heated Vest this power pack seems to keep its charge for a long time its usually about 3 days I will need to charge it again but do note I don't use it 12 hours pr day I use it for about 3 hours off and on pr day.
I love Anker products and have been purchasing many since I can remember. They are very durable and long lasting. This works so great, got to one for my sister too.

My unit failed after a couple of months. Anker support tesponded quickly when called to arrange for a replacement. This power bank holds lots of charge when functioning. We use many Anker products. All reliable.

A good backup battery plan for the phones if the power is gone. Also gifted one to a friend who lives in a remote area where power is often down in the winter. Quality product. Anker products keep getting better and better. When looking for electronics, batteries, or cables, I always try to find and Anker first.

reviewTitle: Fast Charge! Best portable charger of several I've tried!
reviewDescription: My phone died at a dance competition and a friend lent me her charger- which charged my dead Apple 14 unbelievably fast and got me through the last leg of the evening! I was shocked at how fast it worked- in less than half an hour, my phone was more than half way charged. Small and easy to toss in my bag, I am thrilled with this purchase and would highly recommend the Anker brand. I now carry it with me at all times!
My first experience with an external battery and loved its ability to keep my phone charged on a long driving trip.

reviewTitle: 4 lights not blinking and it’s charged!
reviewDescription: Last a very long time and very compact

Muy buena compra, un poco pesadita pero acá en Honduras tenemos cortes de energía de hasta 8 horas y con éste power bank cargo mi celular y uso una lámpara al mismo tiempo, me ha salvado en varias ocasiones

I won't repeat all the good stuff about it rather I will make people aware of how to properly use it (and avoid sending cringe videos not using the product properly).First, the product has a micro USB and a USB C, labeled INPUT ... this is to charge the bank itself. Not your phone or other devices.Second, to charge your device you have 2 USBs labeled IQ. You will NEED an adapter if your device does not charge with a USB. Simple as that but there are people who do not get this obvious thing.Third, make sure you really stick the USB in the socket or else it will not charge.Finally, for charging the bank, if pull power from a wall, use a fast charging block because it will take a very long time.Hope this helped a few folks here.

reviewTitle: Great charger for devices for travel!
reviewDescription: Got this for overseas travel, so that we can always charge up our devices if needed, while traveling. For example, on an overnight trip to Europe- if you don't charge your iPhones, they will likely run out of power later the day of your arrival. We charged up our two iPhones while we slept (or tried to sleep) on the flight and they were fully charged and good to go all day when we landed.  Took it with us on day trips in case we ran low.  Highly recommend. Worth the investment for peace of mind. Good value.

reviewTitle: Beware - Died and Anker warranty functionally impossible
reviewDescription: My error was I bought as a gift too far in advance of a birthday.  One charging port was defective, but when the defect was discovered (90 days after shipment) seller would not take it back and Anker made it impossible to use their warranty process.  it was crazy.  Won't go into detail, but I just gave up after dealing with them couple of times without any luck.  I expected more from Anker, frankly - Lesson learned - buy only low dollar Anker items, check them immediately, don't gift them, and definitely not buy anything with just a 90 day seller return policy.  There really isn't an Anker manufacturer warranty.

I take a lot of photos and videos with my iPhone 14 pro when on vacation.  So I always bring an extra battery.  I was "influenced" by a travel influencer to purchase this battery, and I was optimistic based on the lower price point.  Sadly it didn't work at all on my trip.  I should have tested it out before we left.  I charged it over night so it was ready to go and then didn't work on the vacation at all.  I tried 2 different iPhone cables, and tried it with my friend's iPhone 15 pro too and it didn't work for hers either.  I tried to make a return on AMAZON, but apparently it's non-refundable.  Save yourself some grief, and pay extra for a better battery.

reviewTitle: It says charged because it doesn't charge my phone!  Worthless
reviewDescription: Purchased this charger in Oct 2023 to take on cruises with me.  After leaving plugged in overnight, this thing did not even charge my phone 30%.  I've tried numerous times over the past few months to use this charger and am just completely frustrated with it. I've never had a more useless Anker product and I've bought my share of Anker products.  Do NOT recommend this charger.  It's big and heavy and will not completely charge my Android phone.  Barely keeps my phone usable throughout the day.  Trickle charges.  I'm past the return period and have never left Anker a negative review but this charger deserves it.

I guess I didn’t need to find print that this cannot be returned. I’ve had this plugged in for two hours and it’s only halfway charged. If it’s this slow charging the device, I can imagine how slow it is charging the phone.Quick charge? I don’t think soFalse advertising

I have purchased these before and loved them. I am not sure what happened with this one. Purchased in March and for the last month, I cannot get it to charge. Just stays as 1 bar and blinks. It’s past the return window and I need it for travel so I guess I’ll have to purchase a new one. Disappointed in this purchase.

Very disappointed in the performance .. within a year of buying the device wouldn’t stay charged and would take forever to build up any charge .. it became pointless to use. Do NOT recommend this device.

I have contacted them twice sent them pictures. The charger just stopped holding its charge after charging it all night go to plug it into my phone and it’s dead. I haven’t even had this year and I get no reply from them not good Anker. this is terrible Customer Service. I’m never gonna buy your product again. It’s not even a year and it doesn’t work and you’re not doing anything about it.

reviewTitle: Fire hazard after using it for a few months only
reviewDescription: I have been using Anker products for many years and this battery bank is a major risk. I was using an Anker wall charger with my Android phone's stock USB C to C cable to charge this battery. After a few times, burning smell came out from the USB C port  with burn mark as seen in the photos. I stopped using it right away and contacted Anker but they gave me a hard time. So don't buy this battery if you don't want your house to be burnt down...

reviewTitle: I loved this but it stopped working within 6 months!
reviewDescription: Stopped working & it was expensive.  Very disappointed. I assume an Anker product would be good quality

reviewTitle: Powerbank died after 3 months of use
reviewDescription: I bought this power bank in September for a trip in November. It was used from November to the end of January with no problems and then it would no longer charge. I tried the resetting method different adapters, different cables and contacted Anker for warranty support. I was outside of my three months of use because it sat on my dresser for a month and a half before my trip. They would not replace it so I basically spent $37 on a brick. I would not have bought it if I knew it was only going to last three months, buyer beware!

reviewTitle: Tech support misadvised. Truth is that it will NOT work as a power supply that remains connected.
reviewDescription: Tech support gave bad info. I purchased the Anker as a power supply to leave connected to a GPS tracker. The tech said the Anker battery bank would deplete first, then the GPS tracker battery would deplete second. The technician was wrong.  What actually happens is the Anker automatically turns off and stops being used as the primary battery source, despite that it remains connected and despite that there is lots of charge left on the Anker. The truth is that you must manually push the button on the Anchor begin a new charge cycle. Not practical for the purpose of leaving connected as a power supply. WORSE, since my test took longer than 30 days to discover the bad information from the technician, they would only refund 80%, which I still have not received. Not cool.
I plugged in the usb c to the portable charger to my iPhone 15 pro max and it doesn’t charge it just says “it uses too much power” please help

an ad that is described is not the same this product does not charge iPhone I want one that charges iPhone and it is not the one that arrived I will beat Minnie The product arrived and it does not charge it only has a plug

reviewTitle: The IQ is so low. Can not be charged fully.
reviewDescription: The size and weight are perfect for travel if it works as described.I tried many chargers to charge the battery. When used 5V1A, 5V1.5, 5V2.2A,5V2.4 changers, it got charged to the 4th light quickly. Stopped charging around 10 mins. When check the power, it shows 100% changed with 4 lights on. but when used the battery to charge the phone, it dropped to 1 light in few minutes and stopped charging. Called Anker customer service. Told to use a 5v2.0A changer. I found a Samsung charger with output as 5V2A. It indeed charged the battery for long time from 2 light to 4 light. Then I tried to use the battery to charge my phone. It only charged my iPhone XS Max twice. I do not believe it can charge iPhone xs 5.4 times.

Item worked great until the battery inside started to swell. It became so swollen that it cracked the case. This battery is running the risk of explosion. Of course this happened a few months out of the 18 month warranty. I have purchased many Anker products and they have all been great. This one was a dud and potentially dangerous. I do not recommend this product. I will be looking for an alternative brand for replacement.

reviewTitle: Stopped charging after 6 months despite relatively minimal use.
reviewDescription: Used it probably twice a week to charge a phone for 6 months. Wont charge past 1 blue dot, 2nd dot blinking on charge for 48 hours now... Other reviews mentioning this company not being what it used to be. I have an old power bank from them that has been run through all kinds of travel, works like a charm still. Too bad.

reviewTitle: Doesn’t work and vendor won’t take return
reviewDescription: I bought this portable charge for an international trip. Packed it in my luggage to use, and once I got to my location I found it didn’t work, I then tried using it with another charger and found it worked for maybe 3 minutes, but then found it started draining my battery instead of charging it. On top of that, the seller won’t accept my return so it was a complete waste of money. I would not recommend at all, total disappointment.

I have been experience difficulty in charging the power bank. One day I I kept this power bank charged over night and it still didn’t charge. Light sometimes turn green and sometimes it doesn’t even blink. I’m really upset that this stopped working.

reviewTitle: Do not buy for USB-C powered products
reviewDescription: This power bank does not charge my iPad Pro with the usb-c at all. The only reason I purchased this.  I’ve waited HOURS until this product is at maximum charge  then plug in my iPad Pro only to have the iPad’s battery drained. It’s at max power HOW is it draining my iPad ? Why is it not charging it at all? I’m using Apple’s usb-c/usb-c cable it’s the biggest waste of money. The only reason I didn’t return it when I got it is because it’s handy for my iPhone. Today I’m FURIOUS it doesn’t work as there’s a massive power outage and we’ll be out of resources all day!  Additionally the battery life is less than it states and takes longer to power devices up

This was the worst thing I ever spent money on. It would not hold a charge. Less than 2 weeks having it after I got it charged it died and I couldn’t get it to charge again.I will Never buy this product Again!!
Great product highly recommend

I have used this for travel recently and love how long the battery lasts even after charging my device through the whole day. The only thing is that it is a tad heavy which is why I rated it a 4 out of 5 for traveling. Otherwise this is a great product for someone on the go.

Me ha parecido buenísima esta batería, es quizás un poco más costosa que las demás pero ha sido la mejor inversión porque en viajes tomar fotos y videos descarga super rápido el celular y con esta batería puedo cargar el iphone unas 6 veces antes de tener que cargarla nuevamente (la carga de la batería para estar nuevamente a full capacidad toma varias horas pero vale la pena).

Love this! Have been using it for the past year and took it on many trips! The charge on this thing is insane! It’s a bit on a heavier side, but small enough for portability. I throw it in my purse and it is easy to use. Very durable. Love that there is usb and c charger option.

Pros:1. Simple and easy to use. (as they should all be)2. Solid casing, nothings loose,  feels great has some weight to it.3. Seems to charge devices fairly quick even while in use during charge.4. Large charge capacity as advertised.Cons:1. Comes at half charge and takes 12 hrs just to charge it from half to full charge. so be prepared to charge it for a full day!2. Sometimes it simply won't turn on :( .....luckily if you plug it into a charger for just a second it will wake up and start acting as it should again provided you're in a location where you can do so after all........ Which could negate the need for having it in the first place for some ppl idk.... also may occasionally need to Use the same chords to plug into its input and output simultaneously for roughly 5 seconds to reboot it so if it doesn't work right away don't panic.I love the device personally I believe it's well worth the price. Use all of the time it has long life and works flawlessly
Great buy.

I got this for when I'm traveling or outdoors and want to charge whatever is with me. It does exactly that.I can keep my phone, speaker and friends stuff all juiced up, no problem. I haven't paid attention to see how many times it can completely charge my phone, Samsung S23+, but I have no complaints with its capacity or time to charge something.It does take a bit to charge the power bank, but you know, just do it before bed.
Does a great job

I purchased this power bank December 4, 2021. This was my 3rd purchase of an Anker product.  I was so impressed with the Anker PowerCore+ 26800 and the PowerCore Essential 20000 PD that I decided to purchase this unit.  With this purchase the family was able to quit fighting over having a portable charger to use.  To this day this product works like new. Over the years I have continued to return to Anker for my charging needs. I have purchased 5 Anker charging devices and have been extremely impressed by the quality, durability and longevity of each one.With other brands you may pay less but with Anker, you get the best.

Fully charged, it could not sustain an increasing charge in my phone. And the USB port is broken, so the cord just falls out. No mesh bag. No C cord, just micro.  Weird since I have bought the exact item before. It took Anker two weeks to agree to a return, after Amazon said it could not be returned.

I decided to buy the Anker because of the quality and the dependability that it’s supposed to have. Compared to all the other brands that does power banks. But, I was fooled. I went to work in the garage yesterday on my barn doors and it wouldn’t maintain a charge on my iPad. This was at 35 degree temperature. It would start to charge and then after a few minutes it would then just stop. After about an hour. It went from 70% charge to 8% charge. With the iPad plugged into the power bank. What a disaster! To test it I brought it into the house. And then after a couple hours I tried to charge it with the same set up; power bank and cable used in the garage— it worked. Then I tried it on my iPhone and it also worked inside the house. What’s upsetting is I bought this just in case I have an emergency if I go into the mountains of Colorado. And then I could use it as a back up. Or when I go hiking/backpacking in the mountains I could use it to charge my phone. But I guess I won’t be able to. What a waste of money! Need to find out if they take returns.

A "new" pack is still using USB-A. Who the heck still uses USB-A?!As a gift this product is just awful because I don't have a USB-A to lightning cable.It has USB-C *IN* to charge it but to use it I must buy a new cable.Oh, the writing on the pack is unreadable.

Took overnight to charge this unit to full. Okay.  I decided to see if it could change any device asap and… NADA.  Not an iPad or an iPhone 11 Pro. Tried every cable and switching ends. Watched a few videos but nothing on troubleshooting. Guess nobody can be bothered.No support number to call. The so-called instruction booklet is meant for a dollhouse. Done in teensy sized print in 40 languages so that nobody can read the info.Obviously no quality control by Anker. Just wasting more of a customer’s time to go through all this, plus initiate a return, print up a label, pack up a box, and drive the package to a return center. That’s an hour extra right there at minimum.  I’ve bought cat toys that worked better. Good thing I didn’t rely on this “life saver” device.

I was sorely disappointed with this power bank. Yes, it has a USB-C port, but that is only for changing the power bank (input, not output). I tried to plug in various USB-C cables to see if it would charge anything from the USB-C port. But no. You cannot recharge anything that has a USB-C cable on the other end. It’s dumb.
I have 4 other ankers and this one is the worst I have ever purchased.
After 4 years, it seems broken. Is this going to  A fire hazard?
I bought this for a 3-week trip overseas. It never charged and therefore could not charge my phone and accessories. Too late to return. DON'T BUY THIS.

reviewTitle: Less than a year, it won’t work
reviewDescription: I wanted this to work, came recommended. I used it for traveling and not even a year when it no longer charges things. Can’t refund because of time. But save your money. I used it maybe a total of 5 times on trips.
Did not work for both IP 13pro max & 15 pro max even full battery
Randomly stopped working. I understand these products don’t last forever but purchasing a new one every 6 months is out of the question. I expected a more reliable product from Anker. Lesson learned.

reviewTitle: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!1 Swells up and starts to crack open shortly after the warranty expires!
reviewDescription: About 6 months after the warranty expired on this product it started to swell and finally started to crack open on the back. I called Anker customer service to get advice on whether the device was safe to use in this condition, they said definitely not. Throw it away and buy a new one was their advise. I asked if 18 months to 24 months was months was the life expectancy for this product and he said yes that was the normal life expectancy for Anker battery products! Seriously? You you buy an Anker battery product I guess you just have budget for a replacement after the warranty has expired. I have several other brands of charger batteries that are over five years old and still going strong. And they were lower in price! I guess you don’t always get a better product by paying a higher price…
This just stopped working after a month

reviewTitle: USB C feature does not support powering your phone or other devices, only for input
reviewDescription: This device has a decent rating for power and has a USB A and a USB C port.  However, its USB C port is partially disabled and will only allow you to charge the battery not to then use the battery to power your phone or other device.  This is very surprising and you may order it like I did just assuming the USB C port works like all of the other USB C ports out there, but it does not.... so I returned mine.

reviewTitle: Outdated Charger and No Refunds – A Letdown
reviewDescription: I'm frustrated with my recent purchase of this portable charger. It's baffling that it still uses USB-A output, which doesn't match up with most modern devices. Worse still, the company doesn't honor refunds, even after their products fail to meet their advertised claims. Buyer beware: outdated technology and poor customer service make this a purchase you might regret.

reviewTitle: Dead on arrival will not charge
reviewDescription: Item dead on arrival only partially charged and stopped. Item non returnable. Complete bs...

reviewTitle: USB is getting out of hand and this product is a good example of it.
reviewDescription: TLDR; doesn’t support charging over the USBC port.Anker is a great example of what is wrong with USB. This power bank does not have power delivery over the USBC port, only with the regular USB type A ports.This means that if you bought new Anker chargers, and cables, you cannot use them with this power brick. Basically if I want to travel with anker products, to charge two products (phones/tablets/laptops):1 gen 2 GaN charger which has two USBC ports1 power bank4 USB cables, two USBC to USBC and two USB type A to USBC.Just make everything USBC capable already. This product is a perfect example of what is wrong USB in general. Never mind the fact that you have no idea what which cable is capable of in terms of data transfer and charging speeds.

So I bought this in 2020 and I got a new phone recently in 2024 and it DOESN'T CHARGE MY IPHONE 15 pro as advertised. CAN YOU PLEASE HELP? Did the product change over time from 2020-2024? Or why doesn't mine work?!

I specifically bought this to take to Disneyland on a trip. I am 30 minutes away from Disney so I go all the time and I preferred to buy one off Amazon versus their rods.Upon receiving this, I charged it and it was ready to go. When at Disneyland my phone was dying so I tried to use it and it did not work. I have a new phone therefore I have a new charging wire and it did not work, I tried my sister’s new charger did not work. I even tried an older wire, did not work.Literally attempted to use it the first day and it does not work. I don’t know why I waited so long to leave a review and it’s probably too late to return it and I’m pretty sure at this point I can’t but if I can warn you all to not buy this, I am happy with that.
Product arrived in sketchy packaging and did not work. Read the 1 star reviews, common problem. Also, the product is labeled as "highly returned"

reviewTitle: Long crack like other reviewers - possible fire hazard
reviewDescription: Less than 50 charging cycles, approx 3 years before a crack started to show.My best guess is this is the internal battery swelling, which would be extremely dangerous and a huge fire hazard. A common negative review is this crack, all saying they purchased sometime 3ish years ago.Stay safe, and discharge your battery to less than 15%, the lower the better and consider recycling it.I will update this review if i bother opening it up to see the cause.
This product was great, until it died recently. It took less than a year. I usually expect more from Anker as a repeat customer. Hope they make it right.

I don't understand how something so expensive can stop qorking after hust 6 month, no reason, not a fall, it didnt get wet... just normal use, i even bought the special fast charger and cable from the same brand... got a more potent power bank, and just one week later this one broke.

I have been a fan of Anker products (I have bought many charging banks and cables) since 2014. However, the quality of the products has dropped significantly. Ankers products used to have much longer life expectancy's, better builds and I was more likely to have one stolen (lol) than it becoming dangerous to use.-This particular one has become "bloated" / "swollen" and has a long crack in the back (see picture). As a result, I no longer think its safe to charge. To be fair I bought the product March 2020 and now its Janaury 2023 so it being inoperable is understandable however, being hazardous is unacceptable!-In addition one of the USB ports stopped working 6 or 7 months in. Another observation I have noticed is this model and many others USB-C port never works for whatever reason. Lastly, am I the only long time Anker buyer that's observing a slower charge rate in the newer products? I am more than likely going to look into another brand at this point. No hard feelings!
Stopped charging after the first week.

reviewTitle: USB-C is only to charge pacl
reviewDescription: Buyer Beware... the USB-C port can only be used to charge the battery pack, it cannot be used to charge your desired device. Trying to return item but it says it cannot be returned. Waiting on seller to contact me to resolve this.

reviewTitle: Great functionality, But bulging after 2 years
reviewDescription: Battery is now bulging after 2 years of use. I expect it to become unsafe soon.
After a very long full charge and five days just sitting in a warm room, it would not charge an iPhone at all😩.  I’ll try a few more cycles before returning it than update my review.

The cord sent, charges the product only and does not connect to my iPhone 15k nor does the end of my iPhone 15 charger fit in the product.  So you have to buy a separate cord unless you happen to have one laying around which I didn’t.  I am considering sending it back.

reviewTitle: Worked well, but now has a bulge and crack
reviewDescription: I purchased this new in October of 2020. I am most certainly a fan of Anker products, as their reliability has been excellent over the years. This product has worked well since I've had it, and still works as it should. What's troublesome is the bulge and crack that have developed. The crack started small, but has now grown to almost half the length of the product. For the record, I have always kept this in a protective case when not using or charging it, and none of my other power banks have had this issue. I'm discontinuing my use of it, just to be safe.

I have this power bank with me all the time. It’s the perfect size to bring on hiking trips and to just throw in my Fanny pack.It’s held up great and I’ve had it for months. Still charges pretty quick to full battery and will charge my iPhone 13 like 3 times and maybe a bit more than that. I don’t use it as much to charge two things at once but it does good with that feature as well!

This is a great charger. The reason I giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is because I got the iPhone 15 pro and I needed a new battery package that had a C charger spot So I can charge my new phone. I got the battery and it didn’t charge my phone when iPhone c cord. I had to buy a new cord that has one end usb and the other c in order to use this battery pack. I do not know why the C port isn’t work. If anyone knows why please let me know. You just have to have a cord with a usb end and the other a C end. Other then that’s it’s great!

This power bank will charge your phone fast and you can get multiple full charges from a single charge of the power bank. I wish it had a USC output instead of USC input. I like the 2 USB outputs even though I have only use 1 most of the time. But it is there if I need it. It does have a little weight to it but not heavy to the point of you can't hold it for long periods of time. This is my go to travel charger. I never leave home without it especially if I know I'm going to be using my phone a lot. It has a sturdy feel/ look to it. I have 1 other ANKER charger that I've had for 2 years that I still use.

Only thing is that to charge the portable itself is a pretty slow but makes sense for how long the battery lives.Only possible con is I didn't realize I couldn't charge c-port to c-port, but that was buyer error for not paying attention to details.

reviewTitle: Works as described & such a great back up charger to have for traveling ( or teenagers on the go )
reviewDescription: Update: the first battery charger I received must have been defective because Anker sent me a new one and it works perfect! It does take Approx 18 to get a full charge on the Anker once it’s dead but it charges my devices multiple times before I have to charge it again. Great customer service. I will definitely recommend this charger !Original post : Super disappointed in this powercore but I’m assuming I just received a defect item. I received this In the mail yesterday and it took approximately 18 to get a full charge. As soon it was it was fully charged, I wanted to test it out and charge my daughters iPad And see how it works before we leave on our family Disney trip( which is why I bought this). Are use the power cord that they sent me and the iPhone adapter square thing for the plug. It took about 4 1/2 hours to charge the iPad And it drained the battery on the anchor to 50%!!! Based on all of the other reviews I expected it to charge it quicker than that and to barely Use any of the battery up. Super disappointing as I had hoped it would charge multiple devices if we need it at the Disney parks.  I then plugged it into my phone (Which was at 75%) Just to see how much it would drain the battery on the Anker. While my phone was hooked to it it stopped charging multiple times and I had to keep turning it back on. I definitely think I received a defective device based on all of the rave reviews. I immediately emailed the company & put in for a replacement. I will mail this one back, Fingers crossed the next when I receive will works efficiently. I will update this review once I can try out a new one.

reviewTitle: A Life Saver! I used my Phone for 3 Days with this handy charger!
reviewDescription: I recently purchased the Anker Portable Charger, Power Bank, 20K Battery Pack with PowerIQ Technology and USB-C (Recharging Only) for my iPhone 15/15 Plus/15 Pro/15 Pro Max, iPhone 14/13/12 Series, and Samsung Galaxy. I absolutely love this charger! It has a sleek, modern design and it’s really easy to use. The 20K capacity is great for my long days off the grid and the PowerIQ technology ensures that my devices charge quickly and efficiently. I also really appreciate the USB-C recharging port, which makes recharging the charger super fast and hassle-free. All-in-all, I highly recommend this charger. It’s a great way to stay powered up on the go!

I purchased this for a cruise, and it worked great.  It has a very large capacity, and so takes quite a while to charge fully.  However, I charged my Pixel twice from under 10 to over 90% and still didn't have to recharge it.  Charged my wife's iPhone once, and then recharged it.  Now, I carry it with me anytime I'm not sure how long I'll be without being able to top off my phone.

reviewTitle: The USB-C port works fine! STOP SAYING IT DOESN'T!
reviewDescription: I've seen some video reviews giving this power bank a bad review saying the USB-C port doesn't work when charging their device. IT WORKS FINE! People don't read the manual! The USB-C and micro USB ports are INPUTS. Meaning you use either of those two ports to charge the power bank. You cannot connect a cable to the INPUT ports to charge your device. The other two standard USB ports are OUTPUTS. Those are the ports you connect to in order to charge your phone, tablet, etc. Stop giving bad reviews saying the USB-C port doesn't work. Those people aren't using the power bank properly. After many uses, the power bank holds up and works fine!
I am impressed with the battery life.  Got this to provide portable power for my sp-404 and it's honestly more than I needed, but I'm definitely not complaining.
I like that it is very handy to have.  Sometimes I'm without any source of charging my phone for hours.  Nice and compact. It definitely serves its purpose.
I put this in my purse in order to have a charge available when I needed it. The charger was so heavy I had to take it out.
I just returned from a week's vacation  with a tablet,  a phone and a set of ear pods and never once required a wall outlet! A good product from a company who live up to their reputation!
I take this with me every time I'm driving anyplace! The charge holds great! 4 stars because it is a bit heavy

I repurchased this battery pack. My 1st one lasted just under 2 years. I continued to use it for an additional 6 months, before ordering a new one. This is my go to charging device.  I use it daily. For the price, and amount of use I got out of it, I'm not upset that the battery swelled and cracked the case.

Its pretty sturdy and seems to  do what its supposed to. Id really like there to be a USB-C out port for charging my phone but the 2 USB ports work well.Reasonably fast charging also.I have Anker headphones so thought Id try some of their other products.

reviewTitle: It's does what it is supposed to and it's not too large
reviewDescription: My only grip is that the two output ports are USB A.  The input charging port is USB C.  With many devices moving to USB C, I don't see why this doesn't have a USB C output port. Other than that no issue so far.

Edit: Anker made this problem right and for that I am thankful.  This may or may not be the backup charger that you want...but in my opinion anker is the brand that you should consider.This is probably my fault but what I was originally looking for was a large portable battery that offered usb-c output for more rapid charging.  I have sense realized that the usb-c is ONLY for charging the battery.  I might also add that from empty using usb-A connections be prepared to wait a long time for it to charge.  If you are considering this unit you really need to make sure that you have a usb-c charging cable.  I purposely charged it and then let it sit for several weeks.  The lights still indicated that the battery was full, but I wanted to see how it actually performed.  It surprised me just how well the battery performed.  The battery does have some heft.  It charged an iPhone from 20% to full and while being used and then charged an iPad from 7% while streaming video. The storage and performance is good...but I guess I will have to wait to find one with usb-c output.

I honestly was taken aback by this product.  I've been an Anker customer for years because of their usual superb quality, and I needed a replacement battery pack; so I ordered this one.  The battery has been charging for hours  on the same charger I use for my battery, and nothing.  This is very strange, and concerning as I needed it for travel.  Who ever is reading this, I would not recommend this product.Edit:After spending some time on customer service and telling the assistant my issue, she issued a replacement.  The customer service was phenomenal and the company held its ground as one of the best in my eyes.  Even after the replacement package was stolen, my assistant Sophia sent yet another package to compensate.  Great experience and I would definitely recommend.  This is my fault but I thought that the portable batteries all came with the usb c to usb c power delivery but I was mistaken, disappointed because now I have to buy the 26800 plus pd variant of the charger.  Even worse, I saw the upgraded variant of this with a pd system for cheaper than I bought this unit, that was definitely a bummer.
Lots of capacity to charge devices while on the go. Product is more compact than expected but note that it is a little on the heavier side

Purchased this larger power bank after having three others.  First down side is no bag for it. Also considering the price, it doesn’t seem to hold that much more. Not sure why they wouldn’t offer a bag

We have been purchasing Anker products for about five years, preparing for our six week vacation to Europe, we knew we needed to purchase an Anker Portable Charger, Power Bank, thinking ahead that we may need to charge our cellphones and iPads after a long flight and while on the train traveling from country to country.The power bank is a little heavy to carry in my purse, but it wasn't a deal breaker because had it with us when we needed it. We were able to charge three cellphones, and a couple iPads with one charge, and there was still enough charge for a second and maybe a third round.Not sure, how long it takes to charge 100%, but it didn't matter because I would charge it at night, when one light was left.Excellent product. Totally recommend it.

reviewTitle: Has made life so much more convenient
reviewDescription: First, this product has been wonderful. I originally purchased it for an upcoming camping trip. It did everything I could have asked for for camping and it was so useful I started incorporating it into other areas of my life.It is amazing for traveling. It is nice to know, that no matter where I go, I am set for all of my power consumption needs while traveling. It is the size of a phone but slightly thicker and about twice as heavy as a larger phone. I have found it invaluable for when I have forgotten to charge my phone as it easily fits in my pocket and is the same size as my phone.Finally, the battery life is outstanding. It does take several hours to charge but that battery goes a long ways. I can definitely charge my phone from zero to full twice, and I frequently use it to charge my other battery powered devices.If you are on the fence at all, I would highly recommend this device. It is well built, long lasting, and extremely useful. I would definitely buy this product again.

reviewTitle: Holds a lot of extra power
reviewDescription: I love the fact that it comes in white. When shopping at the store, they were all black. I recently used mine on a short trip, then put it away for several months. I took it out to make sure it still has a lot of charge, and even though it's been months, it was still fully charged. I still have an old phone with games I like to play on it, so I like that it has a C charger port as well as the old style.

This is my second Anker and it never cease to amaze me how impeccable this product is. My first Anker power bank which I had for a while, my GF saw it and asked me to loan it to her. Instead, she kept it. That you don't have to recharge constantly.

reviewTitle: Blows the competition out of the water!
reviewDescription: I have another brand of this same 20,000mAh battery. I thought it was very good -- it charges well, holds a charge well, and would charge my Samsung S10+ and my Garmin Instinct four times each before it ran out of juice.I got this one in prep for the same 60-mile trek to Mount Whitney, knowing my older one probably wasn't up to the task of fully charging the same devices it had the year before. Excellent decision!This one charged the same devices my other, older one charged, except the Garmin was getting two charges a day due to an aging battery. When I got home from my trek, this battery still had three more charges left in it! And it was slightly lighter in weight! Double win!Summary comparison: Older similar 20,000mAh battery: 4.5 charges each for Samsung S10+ and Garmin Insight. This 20,000mAh battery: 9 charges for Garmin Insight, 8 charges for Samsung S10+. So double the charges, for less weight and the same price.

Charge day before you will need to use. It takes a while to fully charge device but that’s because it last a long time. i can charge my dead phone and only use 1.5 notches. I had the version that was a step down and it was clutch for about 3/4 years and had I not lost it, i’d still have it. Great product and price for device! 10/10 recommend!!
It keeps the charge long, charges multiple devices on one charge
Recharge overnight.  Good for multiple usage while away from home.  I didn’t realize I needed a bank, until I bought this!

Okay, I originally did a review saying it didn’t work. Turns out it was user error, I can admit when I’m wrong! I go into San Francisco to walk around and take pictures with camera for hours or even for baseball games and I used my phone a lot to take notes or where I took pictures, get videos of the spots a I took pictures for social media, FaceTime/call my best friend, post on social media. I say all this to show I’m using my phone constantly and this charger helps my phone still have battery when I’m on the train headed home. Highly recommmend, I’m actually thinking of buying 3 more to give one to each of my siblings!
This product has performed beautifully! Most Anker chargers and wires have been amazing to be honest. Their BT speakers, Not so much! Stick to their Chargers and wires!

reviewDescription: I have charged this portable charger for 36 hours and still haven't gotten above 4 lights of charge.  I need to take this with me on a trip where I'll have no access to electricity.  Sending back.

Once that's done it works fine but that extra unnecessary step is highly annoying. I obviously got a defective one. It's also heavy so if I throw it in my little back pack when I go hiking I can feel it's weight back there and it's a bit uncomfortable not to mention putting it in my jacket. reviewTitle: NOT A HIGH SPEED POWER BANK
reviewDescription: I had high hopes as I have had an Anker 2nd-Gen Astro E5 High-Capacity 16750mAh since 2015 and it works like a champ and it is FAST.  This model, however, is very heavy and is NOT a high speed charger.  I returned it and am still looking.

It stopped working in less than a year.the lights come on but do not charge. Takes a long time to fully charge and is a bit heavy. I would not recommend. I wish they still sold the older version. That one lasted years

reviewTitle: Doesnt work after only few uses
reviewDescription: Doesnt work. Poor quality

reviewTitle: Great product but mine died after  uses
reviewDescription: I kept trying to charge it and then bring it somewhere and use it in my phone would never charge and I couldn’t figure out why. All mine does now is blinks three blue dots. I have a friend who recommended this product and she loves it and hers is still going but mine died

reviewTitle: A fully charged device can only offer 12000-14000mAh battery capacity to your devices.
reviewDescription: I have purchased Anker PowerCore Essential 20000mAh Power Bank! I have tested this product in multiple ways (charge and discharge; charge ~ 17630mAh, discharge:1A ~ 14350mAh, 0.5A ~ 14390mAh, 0.25A ~ 14530mAh). As determined the capacity does not correspond to the technical specifications (27.3% less).Anker customer support answer:Usually an external battery could supply 60%-70% power to other devices. Approximately 30-40% of the battery capacity is lost in circuit heat and voltage conversions. a fully charged PowerCore Essential 20000 can only offer 12000-14000mAh battery capacity to your devices.

$62 for prime and the moment the order went in, the price dropped to just over $42... not cool. I would not recommend this product. I am not going through the hassle of returning it over $20 but this kind of business practice just isn't cool with me. 2 stars.

reviewTitle: Overheated and burned itself out after 4 months
reviewDescription: Such a disappointment to see so many glowing reviews and have this one literally overheat when not even plugged in and then not work after that. It could have caused a fire.Great concept, super convenient to have it all in one unit, but I would be super cautious.
The product ok

That wasn't a horrible option, but the problem was I have to keep the car on to charge. No thank you. I have had this charger for about a week and so far I am REALLY impressed!!!  I charged it fully when I got it.  Since then I have inflated a 12 inch tall twin sized air mattress and topped it off a few times, as I have broken the mattress in and needed to add more air.  I also charged my Galaxy Note 9 to a full charge once.  The charger still has 4 lights on, which is the max and I have not needed to charge it a 2nd time.Inflating the air mattress was the most impressive, because the directions mentioned that if the charger was not powerful enough, it would not inflate.  Not only did it inflate all the way, but it did it in a matter of minutes, with plenty of charge to spare.It is a little heavier than my last charger, but I feel it is really worth it given how powerful it is and how long it holds a charge.I highly recommend it!
